summary:
After completing my military service, I worked some years as an assistent auditor and as an accountant in the commercial sector. During these years I completed a BA in economics in education. 
Subsequently, I  obtained a position as a teacher in economics and statistics at a secondary school for evening courses. 
At the same time I started my career as a civil servant at the Dutch Ministry of Economic Affairs, and combining this position with a Masters study at the Erasmus University of Rotterdam (in the evening hours).
In 1980 I started my career as a statistical researcher in the Department of Manufacturing Statistics, firstly as an assistant project leader in ICT projects and later on as a statistical researcher. 
In August 1994 I joined the Statistical Methods Department of Statistics Netherlands and worked as a researcher in different microdata projects. From March 2002 to September 2003 I joined the Netherlands Bureau for Economic Policy Analysis to work for the ICT and Productivity (ICA) Project. 
In September 2003 I returned to the Statistical Methods Department of Statistics Netherlands. Since 1 February 2006 I  am working as a senior researcher at the Science and Technology Section (belonging to the Division of Business Statistics) of Statistics Netherlands.  
In January 2009 I obtained my Phd. at Delft University of Technology on the bases of research published during the last ten years.  My promoters were Prof. Dr. Alfred Kleinknecht of Delft University of Technology and Prof. Dr. Bert Balk (ERIM, Erasmus University Rotterdam).

Specialties: International expert on the econometric analysis of firm level data in the field of ICT and innovation and the link between innovation and firm performance. Expert on statistical methods for the analysis of time series. 

Since my reteriment I am working as a Tutor in Math, Statistics and Economics for High-School, Bachelor and (pre)Master students.

summary:
I am a Singaporean who received my Ph.D. in mathematics from Texas A&M University in 2017, after which I spent 2 years as a postdoc at IMPAN in Warsaw, Poland. Following that, I was at Leiden University's Mathematical Institute as a postdoc for 3 years. In May 2023 I will be taking up a professorship at Jilin University's School of Mathematics.

My research lies on the interface between Banach algebras and large scale geometry of metric spaces, with connections to group theory, dynamics, inverse semigroups, and K-theory.

Besides mathematics research, I am also interested in mathematics education. Before I went to the United States for my Ph.D., I taught in a high school in Singapore for 3 years. I have also taught at college level in the United States and the Netherlands. 

Through my work, I have had opportunities to learn new concepts, analyze them, use them in new situations, collaborate with others, and communicate my results in writing and in oral presentations.

summary:
Victor joined the University of Cape Town’in 2007. He then worked for Shell international in the Netherlands as Research Statistical analyst responsible for business mathematical modeling in the Knowledge Management Department. His research involves dynamic business modeling, including multilevel structural equation modeling, linear and non-linear interactive class modeling and latent growth curves. Past research endeavors included publications to repuatble journals (SACLA, IEEE and ICEL) on knowledge management systems models and inference. 

Currently, apart from providing lectures in Functional Analysis and Mathematical Methods much of the work is focused on measure theories, in sigma algebras. It is anticipated that special fields and operational theories could be an effective way to induce synergy between far spaced domains, henceforth speeding up conversion of theory into practice.       

Other research interests include, statistical inference in business processes, probability theories as applied to business modeling, knowledge management systems models, and e-Business Strategy. 


Other vested interests include applications of Mathematical modeling in business and inference; using Atlas ti in qualitative consultancy and research. 

From  mathematics to computing and modeling "business", it has all been trying to see what is transitory in what is permanent and what is permanent in what is transitory. Once some levels of mastery is obtained, we can then be more certain in isolating and applying our specific reasons to specific areas of need!

summary:
I have over 25 years of experience in international education. Since August 2019 I am working as a math teacher at an international school in Amsterdam. Before that I was International Deputy Principal for Academic Affairs at the Nazarbayev Intellectual School of Astana in Kazakhstan from 2014-2019. The school is part of a large scale educational reform project in the country, bringing international best practices to schools while maintaining and building on strengths already present in the country's educational system. In my role I guided the development of the IB Diploma and Middle Years Programme at the school as well as contributing to the improvement of school management and leadership. 

From 2005-2014 I worked for the IB, first in Geneva, supporting schools in the Africa, Europe and Middle East region in their implementation of the MYP and guiding them through authorization and evaluation. In this role I also trained and managed workshop leaders, consultants and site visitors. Later I worked in Washington DC for the IB in the design and monitoring of the global authorization and evaluation processes as well as in designing services for schools to support them during the authorization process. 

I started my career at a school in the Netherlands, where I worked for 7 years teaching mathematics at secondary level and leading the international section and Dutch bi-lingual section of the school through authorization and successful implementation of the IB Middle Years Programme.



My areas of expertise are curriculum design and development (with a particular emphasis on mathematics), international education, design of accreditation processes and design and provision of teacher training. I also very much enjoy teaching mathematics. I work well independently while also thriving in teams. I am an excellent communicator and strategic thinker as well as being results oriented and an effective planner and organizer. I have a good eye for detail and interdependencies while maintaining the big picture and moving new ideas forward.

summary:
Currently I am a freelance physics teacher at IVIO@school in Lelystad. This institute provides education to children who are not able to be at ordinary schools due to physical or mental disabilities.
in July 2021 I ended my High School Teacher Physics (eerste graads) position at the Maurick College in Vught, The Netherlands. Previous year I was a physics and math teacher at the Sondervick College in Veldhoven. Before that, for at least 10 years, I worked for Philips Healthcare in The Netherlands where I have been leading research teams which focussed on building and validating prototypes for new diagnostic and therapeutic methods, mainly in the fields of Image Guided Interventions (IGI) and Minimal Invasive Surgery. Clinical application areas include Cardio/Vascular (C/V), Oncology and Neurology. Technical expertise include a.o. software engineering of complex industrial medical scanners, image processing and the physics & construction of medical scanners (MR, XRay, CT, US, PET, SPECT) and devices (PACS). Management expertise include leading, coaching and co-ordinating (international) research and development groups ranging from small to large sized groups.

I have a broad interest in all kinds of topics that concern physics, astrophysics, mathematics, computer science and also the history and philosophy of them. In the past 30 years I have maintained my knowledge and expertise about these topics by spending almost every free hour in studying them. I am an enthusiastic narrator and story-teller about these topics. 
I have a friendly and open character, good at making personal contacts and maintaining networks. I am able to make people feel at ease both individually and in teams.

skills: ['Music Production', 'Composing', 'Piano Playing', 'Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)', 'Cashiering', 'Game Development', 'Administrative Assistance', 'Java', 'Microsoft Office', 'Microsoft Excel', 'Microsoft Word', 'Microsoft PowerPoint', 'JavaScript', 'HTML5', 'Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)', 'PHP', 'Python', 'SQL', 'Microsoft Access', 'Customer Service']
summary:
My dream is to make film music. While pursuing a study in math. Weird right?
Creating music to achieve the right mood, the right emotion, for the right audience at the right time, can make a world of difference. I am a big fan of Hans Zimmer, John Powell and Tom Holkenborg. Learning, experimenting, doing and experiencing is what I intend to do the coming years. I would love to come in contact with people who work on promo’s, short films, soundtracks or games.


♪ How it started?
From the moment I could walk and talk, I was singing and dancing. Fantasy and music have played a major role in my childhood. From my fourth to sixth year I attended a number of musical workshops (Utrecht Center for the Arts) and a dance school. I even got lessons from Gigi Ravelli (from GTST a dutch soap). I performed on stage.

Of course I played football, but I was more interested in planes flying over than my direct opponent. At the age of seven I played a piano piece by Bach by heart. Piano lessons were the next step; first from a music student and later from a memorable piano and singing teacher.

I learned to read notes and play classical piano. At the age of 14 I attended an improvisation workshop. Then came experimenting with music production on the computer. This experiment is now a passion and a calling. One thing led to another. For the past five years I have been producing music. Melody and chords created behind the piano. Sometimes I turn it into a piano piece. In 2018, after the 1st year, I quit my bachelor's program Game Technology at Utrecht University. Music kept tugging at me and I answered. Not so long ago (2019) I completed the Electronic Music Production Advanced course at the SAE in Amsterdam.

♪ More?
I have traveled through Europe, Australia, USA and am a (Sci-Fi, Fantasy) film geek. I am me.

summary:
Hoe bereid je jouw huisvesting voor op een duurzame toekomst? 
Wij geloven bij Heijmans in huisvesting die van nok tot nerf duurzaam is. We voegen maximale waarde toe voor de gebruiker, de omgeving én voor de lange duur. 
#Toekomstvastwaarde, noemen we dat. 

Heijmans Utiliteit is binnen Heijmans het onderdeel dat Utilitaire bouwprojecten en services integraal aanbiedt (Werktuigbouwkundig, Elektrotechnisch, en Bouwkundig). Verder zijn wij als Heijmans Utiliteit integrale aanbieder op het gebied van projecten met engineering, uitvoering en (meerjaren) onderhoud.
Daarnaast beschikken wij over tal van specialisaties zoals o.a. Safety & Security, Heijmans Energie Services (HES) en Beyond Eyes om uw gebouw slimmer en efficiënter te kunnen gebruiken. Ik praat u graag bij in een persoonlijk gesprek. 

Wij hebben ons zelf als doel gesteld:
-	Langjarige huisvestingspartner te zijn voor onze opdrachtgevers.
-	Het beste servicebedrijf te zijn met tevreden en loyale opdrachtgevers.

summary:
I am a mathematician with generalist software engineering expertise.

On the software side, I am especially interested in scientific computing (machine learning/data science) and type theory (proofs of correctness). However, I have been running linux and fooling around with code for 10 years, so I have picked up a lot of miscellaneous knowledge, and would be capable of writing most languages in most positions. My favorite languages are Julia, Haskell, and Rust, and I run emacs with vim keybindings; I think that should tell you a good amount about me.

On the math side, I mainly studied category-theory adjacent fields in my bachelors (graduate classes in Algebra, Algebraic Topology, and Algebraic Geometry), and I did my bachelor's thesis on Applied Category Theory. In my master's I'm working on the applied side, so I'm studying probability and statistics. I hope to bring these two fields together in future research.

name: Wouter Kool
skills: ['Research', 'Last Mile', 'Software Projects', 'Mathematical Programming', 'Programming', 'Academic Publishing', 'Leiderschap', 'Computerwetenschappen', 'Wiskundig programmeren', 'Communicatie', 'Lineaire algebra', 'C++', 'Optimization', 'Algorithms', 'Mathematics', 'Machine Learning', 'Software Development', 'C#', 'E-commerce', 'Business Analytics']
summary:
I'm a scientist & engineer with a PhD in machine learning (ML) and a passion for (combinatorial) optimization.

During my PhD at Max Welling's group, I have published and been an (outstanding) reviewer at top ML conferences, on the topic of machine learning for combinatorial optimization / vehicle routing. I received a best paper honorable mention at ICML 2019 for my work on stochastic beam search and I have been a Research Scientist Intern at Google DeepMind. See https://scholar.google.nl/citations?user=DLCKZqUAAAAJ&hl for my papers (1000+ citations), and my github.com/wouterkool for my code (900+ stars).

At ORTEC, I worked on various ML & optimization projects such as warehousing, load optimization and vehicle routing. I initiated and lead the team that won the 2021 DIMACS VRPTW (Vehicle Routing Problem with Time Windows) challenge and I initiated and organized the EURO Meets NeurIPS 2022 Vehicle Routing Competition with over 150 participants and 50 final submissions.

I have participated in many (ACM-ICPC style) programming and math competitions. While Python is my major tool, I have worked with many languages and I am a quick learner so I can code my way around. I like engineering, to build stuff and I will typically find a way to make things work, aiming for optimal results. 

Finally, I'm an enthusiastic presenter: my aim is to make my audience learn and laugh.

summary:
ARCHITECTURE.

WHY?

WE BELIEVE that spaces should empower the existence of people, creating spaces that inspire them, relax them, help them express, help them develop, to have fun, helping them grow, healing them.  
OUR GOAL  is to find the healthiest ways for building your life together. We want to innovate by mixing functions where we think can solve certain misbalances in society like health, behavior, challenging people to have new opportunities to rebuild their way of living. What if you build a hospital inside the zoo?   What if you build a jail inside a cathedral? How can you bring nature inside a building? Why does people heal faster when they can see the energy of the city trough the window? Can the people decide how they want to be healed and where? Where and how do they want to live their last years?  Not only in the creation of living spaces but supporting the natural impulse of finding the answers of life, meaning that we should be able to recreate what we came to do in this planet, our purpose in life. How can you support people in finding these answers? Is a space important to generate this power? Do you feel stronger in  a church? Do you feel happy in the zoo? Can you bring emotions thrue a space?
This is our dream as designers, to create vital spaces. 

VITAAL ARCHITECTUUR.

name: Adrià Puigcerver Carceller
skills: ['Ingeniería', 'Matemáticas', 'Programación', 'Procesos estocásticos', 'Aprendizaje automático', 'Estadística', 'Capacidad de análisis', 'Comunicación', 'Resolución de problemas']
summary:
For me, mathematics was an area of interest for me from a very young age. When I was eight years old, I started Kumon, a Japanese daily math self-study method, which I was performing during nine years until I finished it completely. It greatly aided to develop an advanced knowledge in mathematics that allowed me to place well in various math-related contests. At the age of eighteen, I managed to enter Esmuc, one of the most renowned music conservatories in Spain, while I was preparing for the university entry exams to access the mathematics degree.  Following my admission to the degree program in mathematics, I combined both studies, finishing my math degree in just four years with an average of 7.42 over 10 and my music degree in the fifth with an 8.34 over 10, receiving honors for my final thesis project, which consisted in the creation of a mathematical model to quantify the consonances, applying knowledge acquired in both careers. Furthermore, last year, I started two masters' degrees: one of them in computational engineering and mathematics and the other one in taxation. I enrolled in the second one for my personal interest in accounting, legal and financial matters. I have been studying both masters online at Universitat Oberta de Catalunya, since it provided me with the flexibility necessary to be able to combine them with the numerous rehearsal hours required to finalize my last year at the music conservatory. In the meantime, I have been tutoring a total of fifteen students, most of whom were undergraduates of engineering, mathematics, statistics or related careers.

In addition to the analytical and abstract competences granted after ending the mathematics degree, concluding the music degree has given me certain abilities, applicable when joining a team in a financial company. For instance, playing as a solo musician in a concert with an orchestra requires a great amount of self-confidence and knowing how to proceed under pressure of not failing a single note. Chamber music ensembles have taught me how to be a part of a team, learning good communication and listening skills so as to achieve a common goal, instead of simply trying to stand out individually. Lastly, I possess constancy, perseverance, concentration and initiative, which are indispensable capabilities for a musician.

Finally, on November 1st I moved to Amsterdam to start working as a Quantitative Trader for Optiver.

summary:
Physicist and engineer with a special interest towards energy storage and renewable energy. With a sharp eye for detail, an intrinsic strive for progress and perfection combined with a healthy dosis of curiousity, I aim to aid in the energy transition. 

During my education I quickly developed the skill to translate abstract situations into a mathematical framework. I enjoy diving into a problem, working out the mathematics on a sheet of paper and finding most optimal configurations. All of these are skills that I acquired in my Bachelor of Science in Applied Physics. In my Master's program Sustainable Energy Technology I added to my skillset the ability to numerically solve complicated systems of differential equations. These were usually in the context of Computational Fluid Dynamics, applied for renewable energy generation and storage.

Nothing motivates me more than to watch some efficiency or performance indicator increase because of my efforts. This made my Master's internship at Carbyon a great fit; I numerically investigated how the conceptial design of a Carbon Capture system could be improved in terms of leakage and capture purity. 

Currently I'm concluding my Master's with an experimental graduation research involving metal fuels. Here, I will characterize an existing metal burner and modify it to maximize its performance.

name: Ioannis Diamantis

summary:
I am a geometric-topologist and my primary area of research is knot theory, braid groups and 3-manifolds. My research focuses on the construction of Jones-type invariants for knots and links in 3-manifolds other than the 3-sphere (skein modules), using knot algebras and Markov traces. Recently, I developed an interest on tied links, on pseudo knots & on knotoids.

Highlights:

1. Teaching Award 2018-2019, China Agricultural University

2. Teaching Award 2017-2018, China Agricultural University

3. Awards for Research 2017 & 2020, China Agricultural University 

4. Research Visits:
i. @ Harbin Engineering University, Dec. 2016 (Campus Visit & talk on Skein Modules) 
ii. @ MF Oberwolfach, Germany, April 2015 (Research In Pairs with S. Lambropoulou and B. Gabrovsek)
iii. @ Derby university, UK, February 2020 (Campus visit and talk on Engineering Mathematics).
iv. @ Leiden University, The Netherlands, March & April 2023.

5. Local organizer of the International Conference on Knots, Low-dimensional topology and applications: Knots in Hellas 2016, International Olympic Academy,  Ancient Olympia, Greece, 16-22 July 2016.

6. Organizer of a 9-week seminar on Low-dimensional topology & Knot theory at China Agricultural University, College of Science, Sept.-Oct. 2019.

summary:
Since February 1 of 2019, I have been working as a software developer at the company 12Care, the creator of https://careweb.nl.

In 2015 I completed the bachelor's degree programme Mathematics at the Vrije
Universiteit Amsterdam. This study comprised of math topics like algebra,
analysis, probability theory, statistics and topology, and other useful skills
like computer programming (Java and C++), giving presentations and scientific
writing.

At the end of my bachelor's I learned how one can use Vim digraphs and the
XeLaTeX package unicode-math to add math symbols to documents in a more
convenient way. For instance, to add the symbol β, one normally has to type
"\beta", but with this method one only has to enter "b<backspace>*" which
results in the typing of β directly in the .tex document. Then, the package
unicode-math makes sure this unicode character β is handled correctly by
XeLaTeX.  I think every mathematician should try this method.

After my bachelor's, I started the master's Mathematics, also at the Vrije
Universiteit Amsterdam. I abandoned this study in May 2017 to look for a job
as a computer programmer. 

A few interests of mine are single-board ARM computers and the Chinese language. My math is fine,
I am good at listening and willing to learn.

summary:
CURRENTLY:
Working at Li La Land, creating innovative products to support, inspire and challenge young children to explore the world around them. Co-authored the book 'Speel je mee in Li La Land'​ together with the amazing Irma Smegen, describing 50 detailed activities combining Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Math (STEAM) with language and socio-emotional development. In addition the book provides a strong theoretical basis for a comprehensive and most importantly practical approach to primary education that is truly in tune with the development of a child's young brain and mind. 

WHAT I BRING:
Thinking on how to describe my natural role within a group I came up with the word ‘Vonkeling’. Although it doesn’t exist in Dutch, I derived the word from ‘vonk’, meaning spark, making a Vonkeling ‘someone who sparks’. These sparks can be anything from new ideas and concepts, perspectives or insights, depending on what the situation asks for. Being an artist I’m able to compose stories with words or visuals that spark connections between the people involved. After all, data points and abstractly formulated values have never motivated people, but well-presented stories can push us to move mountains. This makes me a strong brainstormer and concept developer who can also bring different people together to make ideas become reality. My enthusiasm has been characterised as being 'contagious'​ and I love igniting other people's passions to strive for our shared goals.

Marleen Vente

summary:
I am always searching for mechanisms behind our brain processes. Why does something work the way it does? How can respiratory viruses cause CNS disease? I have a very broad background, which helps me to assess problems with different views. People know me as hard-working, eager to learn and never hesitating to ask questions.
📧 Connect & Message me for my email!

I got fascinated by molecular neurobiology early during my bachelor Psychobiology in Amsterdam. I did a 5-month internship where I studied the learning-induced transcription factor Egr1 as possible tool for viral gene therapy for Alzheimer’s disease. To focus more on research, I chose to follow the master programme ‘Molecular and Cellular Life Sciences’ in Utrecht. I finished my first internship in electrophysiology to study the relationship between the endocannabinoid system and HCN-channels (Synaptic Physiology lab, Utrecht). My second internship was focused on studying how influenza A virus can induce CNS disease (Viroscience department, Erasmus MC). From October 2021, I started as a PhD student to study how respiratory viruses can cause CNS disease (Viroscience department, Erasmus MC).

Jan de Lange is mathematician by education. (Leiden. Detroit, Utrecht). After teaching at high schools and universities he became educational reseacher at the Freudenthal Institute for Innovation in Mathematics Education (University Utrecht). Shortly thereafter het became leader and full professor/director of this institute. He initiated many new projects and activities like the Nieuwe Wiskrant (Math Magazine), National Mathematics Days, Math-A-lympiade, designed learning materials (Math-in-Context), designed curricula (mathematics A). At present he is senior designer of  a tablet based curriculum for mathematics for Pearson in the USA. 
He also was member or chair of many national and international commissions (Mathematical Sciences Education Board (Washington DC), Chair of International Expert Group PISA Mathematics (Paris, Melbourne), Visiting Professor University of Wisconsin (Madison), Honorary Chair Mathematics Education Research Institute (Being).

He founded the Project Curious MInds with Robbert Dijkgraaf & Johan van Benthem in 2005, and as a result the Book "Play Smart" was published in Dutch in 2013. It is about the amazing talents of young children, their curiosity, their reasoning skills, especially in the area of science and technology. It offers parents tools to facilitate a more complete cognitive development.This book is also the backbone of the recently started Young Parents Academy (jongeouderacademie.nl).
 
In 2011 he won the Lifetime Achievement Award van de International Society for Design and Development in Education (ISDDE).

He has presented numerous keynotes and lectures in 60 countries over a wide variety of subjects.

summary:
“Wanna know why? I have a dream!” © One famous senator.

I used to be a scientist and a teacher. I like to learn about the world and share this knowledge with others. I was doing physics and math with sparkling eyes, and society promised me a bright future. 

But the light of this spark is no match for a star — and my starlight is my passion for creating. Every time I discover an amazing new world in a game — HoMM, WoW, Witcher, Destiny, Ori, and many others  — I feel like I want to make as many awesome games as possible. That is my dream.

One day I wondered: “Why do I do my favorite activity after everyday work when I can do it all the time?” Since then I’ve been in the gaming industry for over 5 years I have discovered the following about myself.

My scientific background and hobbies allow me to combine complex activities:
- Math and art  — I can create advanced monetization and game balance models as well as drive my creative ideas to delivery
- Narrative and game design  — I can develop innovative features and memorable narrative content
- Old and new game design schools  — I can work with different types of target audience.

I educate, refine and drive myself to be a better person:
- I am constantly learning because I never settle
- I stay calm when faced with adversity
- I focus heavily on results but also enjoy the process.

People love working with me because:
- I am patient, polite, and considerate with solid teamwork skills
- I am generous when it comes to sharing experiences
- I enjoy learning as well as teaching and mentoring.

I am great at social connections, teamwork, and strategy-making. In my opinion, it’s essential because great achievements are made in close-knit teams. I am happy to share my knowledge and become a part of a new team. Feel free to contact me.

position 1: 'De Gelabelde: Pleidooi voor een genuanceerde wereldbeschouwing' (februari 2022)
summary:
Kopie van website:

Dilara Bilgic (Adiyaman, 2002) is schrijver, spreker/moderator en freelancepublicist (bij De Correspondent en De Groene Amsterdammer). In 2020 verscheen haar debuut, De Black Box Democratie (Boom uitgevers), een politiek-filosofische analyse van de democratie in Nederland.

In 2022 verscheen haar tweede boek, De gelabelde (uitgeverij Pluim), een literaire non-fictie over de invloed van labels op het leven van mensen. Het boek werd genomineerd voor het Mooiste Boekomslag 2022 en de Jan Hanlo Essayprijs. Ook schreef ze een essay voor De Buitenkant (uitgeverij Pluim), een essaybundel over ”de meetlat die je als vrouw altijd bij je draagt: de buitenkant”.

Naast het schrijven geeft Dilara ook lezingen, gastlessen en werkt ze aan projecten. Zo hield ze de vijftiende Amersfoortse Bergrede over het giftige hokjesdenken in onze klassenmaatschappij.

info@dilarabilgic.nl

As a lawyer at Stibbe I act for companies, developers and public bodies, such as municipalities, provinces, education and other public institutions, representing them in negotiations and before the Dutch and European courts. 

My specialisations include general administrative law, financial public law (subsidies), compliance and sanctions, planning and zoning, environmental law, expropriation, governmental liability, public access to governmental documents, public transport and aviation. Furthermore, I specialise in public law litigation, fundamental human rights, state aid, European administrative law and education law. 

In addition I hold a part-time professorship in constitutional and administrative law at Leiden University. I publish and teach on several administrative law issues. I am a member of the executive board of the Dutch Administrative Law Association and the board of editors of the Dutch Magazine for lawyers (Nederlands Juristenblad).

name: Eva Gladek
skills: ['Sustainability', 'Sustainable Development', 'Climate Change', 'Environmental Awareness', 'Sustainability Consulting', 'Renewable Energy', 'Environmental Policy', 'Environmental Science', 'Life Cycle Assessment', 'Corporate Social Responsibility', 'Research', 'Energy Efficiency', 'Sustainable Business', 'Project Management', 'Ecology', 'Environmental Impact Assessment', 'Energy', 'Carbon Footprinting', 'Strategic Planning', 'Environmental Management Systems']
summary:
Eva Gladek is the founder and CEO of Metabolic, a consulting, research, and venture building firm focused on tackling global sustainability challenges and advancing a circular economy. Eva founded Metabolic in 2012 with the mission of transitioning the global economy to a fundamentally sustainable and circular state. Metabolic provides strategies and tools, crunches data, creates new technologies, builds pilots and scales up innovations. Headquartered in Amsterdam, Metabolic has an international and interdisciplinary team working with governments, businesses, and non-profits around the world.

Eva holds a Master’s in Industrial Environmental Management from Yale University and a Bachelor’s in Molecular Biology from Amherst College. In her years of consulting work and concept development, Eva has advised hundreds of organizations, ranging from progressive cities such as Amsterdam to global NGOs like WWF, as well as industry leaders in nearly every economic sector. She is an expert in technical environmental management techniques such as Life Cycle Assessment and Material Flow Analysis, and has developed a number of frameworks for systems thinking and sustainable design. She is the acting CEO of Systemic, Metabolic's new software arm that builds decision support tools to make it easier for organizations to make the most sustainable decisions across their operations, and serves on a number of boards, including  Amsterdam’s International Economic Development Board, Metabolic Institute, Metabolic Foundation, and Spectral. Eva also regularly provides keynotes at international conferences that explore sustainability and the circular economy. She has been featured in a range of media outlets, including the New York Times, The Guardian, PBS, and The Economist. 

Eva consistently ranks as one of the top sustainability influencers in the Netherlands, a country recognized as leading the transition to the circular economy. She has been named in the Trouw’s list of top sustainability influencers each year from 2015-2018. In 2017, Eva was named in the Duurzame 50, which recognizes people who have the ‘power, charisma, contacts and vision to preserve the built environment.’ Metabolic has also received a number of awards for its work in urban development, agriculture, global supply chains, and decision-support tools.

Prior: University of Amsterdam, Rights Watch (UK), PAX, T.M.C. Asser Instituut, Duke University. Twitter @jessicadorsey.

I hold an LL.M., cum laude, from the University of Utrecht in Public International Law and a J.D. from Washburn University School of Law, from which I also received a Certificate in International and Comparative law, with distinction. In 2018, I received the Graduate of the Last Decade (GOLD) Award from Washburn University School of Law Alumni Association.

I am a native English speaker, fluent in Dutch and I also have a good command of Spanish and a basic command of French. Open for consultancies, trainings, guest lectures and good coffee.

name: Marian de van der Schueren
field of studies 2: 'Malnutrition in head and neck cancer patients'
skills: ['Healthcare', 'Nutrition', 'Dietetics', 'Clinical Nutrition', 'Clinical Research', 'Clinical Trials', 'Research', 'Cancer', 'Elder Care', 'Healthcare Management', 'Oncology', 'Health', 'Science', 'Writing', 'Excel', 'Clinical', 'Public Speaking', 'Treatment', 'Public Health']
summary:
I am a professor of Nutrition, Dietetics and Life style at the HAN University of Applied Sciences and a professor of Dietetics at Wageningen University & Research. My daily activities include (coordination of) nutrition research, with special focus on nutrition for older adults. Also, empowering dietitians and the dietetic profession to prove effectiveness of dietetic interventions in daily practice is a major research area. 

I am a member of the Dutch Dietetic Association, The Dutch Academy of Nutrition Scientists, and chair of the section adults of the Dutch Malnutrition Steering Group. I am on the supervisory board of the international initiative Nutrition Day. I am on the editorial board of the Nederlands Tijdschrift voor Voeding en Dietetiek. I have been on the  board of the Educational and Clinical Practice Committee within ESPEN and on the board of its Dutch daughter society NESPEN for many years. 
In the past, I have participated in the Dutch Annual Measurement of Care Problems and in several committtees of the Health Council of the Netherlands. I am on the core group of the Global Initiative on Malnutrition (GLIM) to come to a worldwide set of diagnostic criteria for malnutrition. 

I started my career as a clinical dietitian at Antoni van Leeuwenhoekziekenhuis and OLVG. I moved to Amsterdam umc (location VUmc) and worked at VUmc for almost 30 years, as a clinical dietitian, as PhD candidate, as manager and as senior researcher. 
I did my PhD on 'Malnutrition in head and neck cancer patients' (2000). Then I became head of the Department of Nutrition and Dietetics of the VUmc, supervising approximately 40 employees, including dietitians, nutrition support team nurses, researchers and secretaries. In 2009 I decided to focus on research only. During the past few years I have been supervising PhD students, teaching, and acquiring research grants.

In 2019 I was awarded the EFAD European Fellowship Award 2019: ".......for her continuous, outstanding and significant contribution to the advancement of dietetic practice, research and education at a national and international level. Over almost 30 years, Marian has built up a multifaceted and thorough expertise in dietetic patient care, research and education. Her research activities span most of the entire professional field. She maintains regional, national and international networks in healthcare, research and education. Her goal is to use her ability to inspire people to get along with both professional field and researchers to take dietetics to a higher level".

This is Jara Pascual, SaaS digital platform founder, author and consultant, who I am helping corporates, universities and founders to go to the next level in their innovation ecosystems, collaboration and innovation journeys. SHORT BIO
Jara Pascual, MBA and Master of Telecommunication Engineering, is founder and CEO of Collabwith, an author of the best-seller "Innovation and Collaboration in the Digital Era" and an entrepreneur focused on innovation. Collabwith is an online platform for innovation ecosystems and structured collaboration for innovation across sectors.  As board member of the Forum Knowledge4Innovation, her voice is heard regularly at the European Parliament and the European Commission discussing the topics of female investment, innovation ecosystems, innovation procurement, digitalization, from Lab to Market and academia-industry collaboration. Recently she is Chair of the Working Group Innovation Ecosystems for IOT at the AIOTI. She is also the host of the Innovation Podcast "Business of Collaboration". She writes about innovation and collaboration management for different online magazines, is a telecommunications engineer and has worked for 15 years in Innovation Management doing transformational innovation culture and projects in a number of Fortune 500 Companies such as adidas Group, ECCO Shoes, Tommy Hilfiger, Calvin Klein and R&D Labs.

More than 10 years ago, she founded the site espanolaenmunich.com to help expats in Germany, and she is author of the children book "Rafael and Virginia are moving to Germany".

name: Tanja Masson-Zwaan
position 1: Asst. Professor and Deputy Director, International Institute of Air and Space Law
position 2: Vice President for Science and Academic Relations
skills: ['International Law', 'Research', 'Consulting', 'International Relations', 'French', 'Policy', 'Program Management', 'Aerospace', 'Teaching', 'Project Management', 'Public Speaking', 'English', 'Analysis', 'Space Law', 'Aviation', 'Aviation Law', 'Diplomacy', 'Arbitration', 'Space Policy', 'European Law']
summary:
I am Asst. Professor / Deputy Director of the International Institute of Air and Space Law at Leiden University.  In 2016 I was elected President Emerita of the International Institute of Space Law (IISL), having served as its President from 2007-2016 and as Executive Secretary from 1991-2007. I am a full Faculty member of International Space University.

I advise the Dutch government on the implementation of the Dutch Space Activities Act, teach and supervise students at Bachelors, Masters and PhD level, and carry out research and publish on a broad range of space law topics. In 2019 I co-authored the 4th edition of 'Introduction to Space Law' (Kluwer).

I am Secretary of the Stichting Space Professionals Foundation (SSPF), which provides funding to 'NL-connected' participants for short duration space-related courses, such as the Space Studies Programme of ISU.

I lectured at many universities worldwide, set up courses in air and space law at the National University of Singapore, and worked as a consultant for a space insurance broker in France and in my own company in The Netherlands.

I currently serve as advisor to or on the board of various organisations, such as Open Lunar Foundation, ASU Interplanetary Initiative, UARX Space, Space Generation Advisory Council (SGAC), China Institute of Space Law (CISL) and Mars One, and am a member of the Board of Editors of Air and Space Law (Kluwer). Previously I was a member of the Advisory Committee of Secure World Foundation (SWF) and member of the Founding Boards of Women in Aerospace-Europe and of the European Centre for Space Law (ECSL). I am an elected member of he International Academy of Astronautics, the Académie de l’Air et de l’Espace, and the International Law Association. 

The Dutch Government appointed me as arbitrator for space related disputes at the Permanent Court of Arbitration, and as member of the Space Learning Group of ICAO. 
I co-founded The Hague International Space Resources Governance Working Group.

I received the Distinguished Service Award of the IISL (2001), the Social Sciences Award of the International Academy of Astronautics, IAA (2008) and the IAF Distinguished Service Award (2015). In 2018 I became the first female member of honour of the Netherlands Space Society, where I previously served as  Vice Chairman, and received a Royal decoration for my work in space law as Officer in the Order of Orange Nassau in 2020.

My personal mission is to make research happen. As owner of DrEAMS Funding Consultancy (www.dreamsfundingconsultancy.eu), I offer research strategy advice, grant writing and funding support to scientists from the Life Sciences & Health and other sectors.

I have been active in the LSH domain since 1994. After obtaining my PhD degree, I worked as a managing biochemist at a biotechnology company till 2002. I then moved to various decentralised and central strategic positions at the largest university medical center in The Netherlands to write competitive grant proposals, set up and coordinate large national and international research consortia, scout and advise on national and international funding opportunities, and promote the (inter)national positioning of the institution and its scientists. In May 2020, I joined HollandPTC as Director Research & Education. I supervised the R&D department including the R&D facilities, and was responsible for the implementation of the HollandPTC research programme on proton therapy. As member of the Management Team, I took part in setting the strategy and running the operations of the organisation. In April 2022, I started DrEAMS Funding Consultancy as part-time freelancer. Since mid November 2022, I am a full-time freelancer.

I have a broad national and European network of research managers and administrators. I am mentor and trainer for the European Association of Research Managers and Administrators (EARMA), co-founder and former vice-chair of the Association for Research Managers and Administrators - The Netherlands (ARMA-NL), and have been a core group member and working group leader of the COST Targeted Network BESTPRAC.

name: Nadieh Bremer
position 1: Freelancing Data Visualization Designer & Data Artist
skills: ['Data Visualization', 'Data Analysis', 'R', 'Data Mining', 'Analytics', 'Statistics', 'd3.js', 'Statistical Modeling', 'Mathematical Modeling', 'Public Speaking']
summary:
I’m a freelancing data visualization designer and artist, working from a tiny town near Amsterdam, with a background in data science & a graduated Astronomer. 

I work to captivate and engage an audience with the insights that the data reveals. To convince them of the lessons hidden within the numbers. To take readers along on a journey told through the lens of data.

In 2016 I was chosen as Rising Star and in 2017 I became Best Individual in the Kantar Information is Beautiful Awards. I’ve worked with small start-ups, magazines like Scientific American, all the way to global multinationals such as Google to help them get the most out of their data. And this can be done through both static or interactive visualizations, for online or print. So long as there’s data that has a story to reveal.

For each project I design my visualizations completely custom build. Starting from the actual data & goals, not the “available charts”. Resulting in engaging, beautiful and effective visualizations of your data. And taking the creativity one step further, I also love to turn numbers into data art or branding material, since your company’s data is inherently unique. Something that entices the eye first and foremost while still hinting at patterns found in the data.

I can take on the entire data visualization process. From data analysis, to design, to creating the final stand-alone piece. But I can also focus only on the design of the visualization an afterwards act as an advisor to your own front-end developers or analysts. Get in touch to discuss what works best for you! And please, if you'd like to get in touch, email me at info @ visualcinnamon.com, I often forget about LinkedIn.

(PS I only accept people on LinkedIn that I know, if you want to stay up to date with my posts, follow me instead! :) )

name: Maarten Steinbuch
position 2: Member of the Board of Advisors
skills: ['Mechatronics', 'Automotive', 'Dynamics', 'Robotics', 'Dutch', 'R&D', 'Matlab', 'Engineering', 'Control Systems Design', 'Motion Control', 'Finite Element Analysis', 'Simulations', 'Solidworks', 'Manufacturing', 'Modeling', 'Embedded Systems', 'Mechanical Engineering', 'Simulink', 'Electronics', 'Physics']
summary:
Maarten Steinbuch (born 1960 in Zeist, NL) is a high-tech systems scientist, serial tech entrepreneur and keynote speaker. He holds the chair of Systems & Control at Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e) (0,6 FTE) where he is Distinguished University Professor. His research spans from automotive engineering to mechatronics, motion and fusion plasma control. He is most known for his work in the field of advanced motion control, as well as in robotics for high precision surgery. Steinbuch is a prolific blogger and a key opinion leader on the influence of new technologies on society. He is well known as an advocate of electric vehicles and airplanes.

He received the M.Sc. degree (cum laude) & Ph.D. Degree from Delft University of Technology, in 1984 and 1989 resp. From 1987-1998 he was with Philips Research Labs., Eindhoven as a Member of the Scientific Staff. From 1998-1999 he was manager of the Dynamics and Control group at Philips Center for Manufacturing Technology.
Since 1999 he is full professor Systems and Control and chair of the Control Systems Technology group of the Mechanical Engineering Department of Eindhoven University of Technology. He was Editor-in-Chief of IFAC Mechatronics (2009-2015), and is chairman of the supervisory board of MyWheels, and member of the supervisory board of the topsector HTSM, (adv) board member NWO-SIA, MAEVE Aerospace, Nobleo Technology,  Lumo Labs, WorldEmp, Classified Cycling, ScoutInScience, AcTI, the Dutch Association for Precision Engineering, member of the Sustainability Board of NPM Capital, (co)founder of MI-Partners, Mechatronics Academy, Preceyes, MicroSure, Eindhoven Medical Robotics, ZEnMO, NRG2Fly and Steinbuch in Motion. He is a micro-investor and shareholder of MyWheels (Amber), Lightyear, MAEVE Aerospace and eFlight. He was Scientific Director of the TU/e High Tech Systems Center 2014-2020. Since 2018 he is Scientific Director of Eindhoven Engine. In 2003, 2005, 2008 and 2015 he obtained the 'Best-Teacher' award of the Dept. of Mech. Eng. TU/e. In 2008 and 2014 his research group obtained the QANU excellence rating [5555]. In 2013 he was appointed Distinguished University Professor at TU/e. In 2015 he received the KIVI Academic Society Award, and in 2016 he was awarded as Simon Stevin Meester 2016, the highest Dutch award for Scientific Technological research. Maarten Steinbuch has numerous ISI (web of science) highly-cited papers, > 350 publications in ISI web of science and has > 4500 citations (H-index 39). In Google Scholar > 13000 citations, H-index 60. He is IEEE Fellow.

name: Janneke van Heugten
skills: ['Public Relations', 'Social Media', 'Marketing', 'Publicity', 'Public Speaking', 'Copywriting', 'Social Media Marketing', 'Magazines', 'Corporate Communications', 'Presentations', 'New Media', 'Advertising', 'B2B', 'Training', 'Online Advertising', 'Publications', 'Interviews', 'Radio', 'Strategic Communications', 'Content Management']
summary:
Oprichter Mediaplatform VIDM. Volgens Communicatieonline (2018) een van de 10 jonge communicatietoppers die de toekomst van het communicatievak bepalen. Van Heugten staat ook in de De Kleurrijke 50, dé lijst met gamechangers in diversiteit uit de marcom industrie.

Over VIDM:
Je vakgenoten versterken hun expertstatus met media-aandacht; jij vraagt je af waarom redacties jou niet bellen. Of je wordt wél gebeld, maar zegt ‘nee’ omdat je geen robbertje vechten wilt.

Wellicht wil je vaker interviews geven, maar weet je niet hoe je de pers benadert. Of je denkt dat je een nieuwswaardig verhaal hebt, maar niemand lijkt geïnteresseerd.

Herkenbaar? Mediaplatform VIDM helpt je laagdrempelig, met effectieve middelen, vaker en beter in de media te verschijnen.

Waaronder:

* Contactgegevens van journalisten (basis perslijst)
* (Online) Sessies met journalisten, media- en communicatietrainers, onder wie Janneke zelf
* Digitale middelen (van video tot checklist) met tips van journalisten en trainers waar je echt wat aan hebt.

Al deze middelen zijn voor de leden van VIDM beschikbaar maar zijn wel afhankelijk van het gekozen lidmaatschap.
VIDM draagt bij aan een realistische afspiegeling van de maatschappij in de media, wat zich vertaalt in laagdrempelige lidmaatschappen.


Aanmelden als expert:  www.vakerindemedia.nl
Aanmelden als journalist/redacteur: www.vidm.nl

Specialties: public relations, gender & media

skills: ['Geschiedenis', 'Suriname', 'Brazilie', 'historische voorwerpen', 'History', 'Curating', 'Museums', 'Research', 'Art', 'Photography', 'Turkije', 'Archiefonderzoek']
summary:
Eveline Sint Nicolaas is senior conservator Geschiedenis bij het Rijksmuseum met als specialismen de historische betrekkingen met Suriname, Brazilië en het Caraïbisch gebied, de collectie ‘Turkse schilderijen’ uit het bezit van ambassadeur Cornelis Calkoen (18e eeuw) en de geschiedenis van Nederland in de achttiende eeuw in het algemeen.
In juni 2018 verscheen haar boek Ketens en Banden. Suriname en Nederland sinds 1600, het laatste deel van de Landenreeks van het Rijksmuseum. Eveline gaf leiding aan het team van conservatoren van de tentoonstelling Slavernij (2021) en droeg bij aan het boek en de programmering bij de tentoonstelling. Van 2015-2022 was zij voorzitter van de werkgroep terminologie van het Rijksmuseum.

Eveline Sint Nicolaas is senior curator of History at the Rijksmuseum, specialising in historical relations with Suriname, Brazil and the Caribbean, the collection of 'Turkish paintings' from the property of ambassador Cornelis Calkoen (18th century) and the history of the Netherlands in the 18th century in general.
In June 2018, her book Shackels and Bonds. Suriname and the Netherlands since 1600, was published, the latest volume in the Rijksmuseum's Country Series. Eveline led the team of curators of the exhibition Slavery (2021) and contributed to the book and programming accompanying the exhibition. From 2015-2022, she chaired the Rijksmuseum's Terminology Working Group.

name: Tahir Abbas
skills: ['Theory', 'Politics', 'Qualitative Research', 'Quantitative Analysis', 'Ethnography', 'Sociology', 'Anthropology', 'Quantitative Analytics', 'Higher Education', 'University Teaching', 'International Relations', 'Research', 'Lecturing', 'Political Science', 'Teaching', 'SPSS', 'History', 'Academic Writing', 'Quantitative Research', 'Social Sciences']
summary:
Tahir Abbas, Professor of Radicalisation Studies, Institute of Security and Global Affairs, Leiden University

Tahir Abbas, FAcSS, is a Professor of Radicalisation Studies at the Institute of Security and Global Affairs at Leiden University in The Hague. He is currently the Scientific Coordinator of the European Commission (EC)-funded H2020 Drive project, which is exploring radicalisation and social exclusion in northwest Europe. He is also the Principal Investigator of the EC-funded Protone project, which explores ways in which to protect religious places of worship in Europe. He was a Reader (Associate Professor) in Sociology at the University of Birmingham (2003–2010) and a Professor of Sociology at Istanbul University (2010–2016) before joining the Institute in August 2018. He was also a Senior Research Officer in the UK government (2001-2003) and a Senior Research Fellow at the Royal United Services Institute (2016-2018). His recent books are Ruminations (Beacon, 2022), Islamophobia and Securitisation (Springer, 2022, with L. Welten), Countering Violent Extremism (Bloomsbury, 2021), Islamophobia and Radicalisation (Oxford University Press, 2019), and Contemporary Turkey in Conflict (Edinburgh University Press, 2017). His recent edited books are Political Muslims (co-ed. with S. Hamid, Syracuse University Press, 2019) and Muslim Diasporas in the West: Critical Readings in Sociology (4 vols., Routledge Major Works Series, 2016). He is the author of five single-authored monographs and one co-authored monograph; editor and co-editor of 18 books and special editions; and author and co-author of over one hundred peer-reviewed scientific papers, book chapters, encyclopaedia entries, book reviews, and over seventy-five op-eds and blogs. He has recently been a visiting scholar at the London School of Economics (2017–2019) and New York University (2015–2016). He is a Fellow of the Academy of Social Sciences. www.tahir-abbas.com

summary:
Marije werkt vooral in en voor het lokale bestuur. Ze begeleidt vernieuwende samenwerkingen, onderzoekt klassieke participatie, adviseert over de rol van het bestuur en helpt ambtenaren. Ze heeft een grote 'bias voor bewoners'.

Rode draad in haar werk is de vraag of het er een beetje democratisch aan toegaat, en hoe dat beter kan. Haar lievelingsthema? Hoe vergroten van de zeggenschap van bewoners de democratische kwaliteit kan verhogen. 

Maar zij ziet in haar werk in organisaties en bij samenwerkingen ook veel verspilling van energie, niet werkende routines en goede bedoelingen met ellendige gevolgen. Vandaar haar belangstelling voor: stoppen. Ze schreef er een boek over, dat genomineerd is voor Managementboek van het Jaar 2021. 

‘Stop. Stopstrategie voor organisaties’ leidt je in in het ambacht van stoppen. Marije is een kampioen in het leuk, eenvoudig en aantrekkelijk maken van stoppen en schudt hard aan je overtuiging dat stoppen per definitie verliezen is.

‘Je bent wel gek als je na het lezen van dit boek niet met heel veel gaat stoppen.’ – Leike van Oss & Jaap van ’t Hek

Business developer, Entrepreneur, CCO in software (SaaS) companies.

Personal Skills
Business Developer | Entrepreneur | Matchmaker | Sales | Marketing | Strategy | ScalingUp

- Winner Hospitality Innovation Award - 2016
- Winner McKenzie Pitch to Partner contest New-York - 2015
- Winner Get in the Ring Amsterdam 2015
- Top3 Best Starting Online Entrepreneur of the year 2015 (LOEY AWARDS)

Over Tim:
Als Startup ondernemer heeft Tim verschillende bedrijven opgericht.
Het bedrijf Prindustry is vandaag de dag een marktleider in web2print software en Digital Asset Management. Tim stond aan de wieg van de webshop functionaliteiten en maakte de verbinding met de eerste 100 klanten. 

Bardoggy is een platform voor de horeca. In de tijd van lancering waren er apps als MyOrder, Scoopy en IENS die (met name gericht op restaurants) de verbinding maakte tussen bezoeker en locatie. Er was geen dominante speler specifiek voor de cafe horeca en de uitgaanssector.
Met funding (in totaal ca. 1miljoen), en een team is de MVP gelanceerd en groeide BarDoggy uit tot een app met voordeel coupons bij populaire uitgaanslocaties. Producenten sloten zich aan en konden kwalitatieve introducties van nieuwe producten aanbieden of juist bestaande producten een boost geven. 

Op het hoogtepunt zijn er 500 horeca locaties actief op BarDoggy en worden er wekelijks tienduizenden drankjes met de app aangeschaft.De conservatieve en traditionele houding van de sector maakt dat het lastig is om de meerwaarde van de consumentendata te kapitaliseren waardoor na 5 jaar een concreet verdienmodel uitblijft. De technologie is verkocht en het platform is in 2020 uit de lucht gehaald.

In commerciële rollen bij Print.com (250 FTE) en Lytho (40 FTE) is Tim verantwoordelijk voor de groei. Als teamspeler zoekt hij  graag de verbinding met collega’s om samen tot een mooi resultaat te komen. Hij geeft leiding op een mensgerichte manier en heeft focus op een goeie teamdynamiek. 

De heeft Tim ruim 50 bedrijven begeleid als startup en business coach. Daarnaast is hij spreker en geeft hij workshops over business-modelling en ScalingUp. Op strategische vlak is Tim betrokken bij talentontwikkeling, schaalbaarheid van Novel-T en de langetermijnvisie / strategie.

summary:
Global energy demand is expected to double by the second half of this century, driven by population growth and increase in energy use per capita in developing countries. Providing this energy in a sustainable manner is one of the key challenges of our generation.

I am an energy business professional with broad technical and commercial background, motivated to bring scale to the energy transition to meet sustainable energy needs.

After graduation I worked on large scale energy projects around the world in various technical and business development roles in Shell. Learning the energy business I realized its importance for prosperity but also its impact on our environment and wanted to make a difference in the energy transition. I joined the New Energies business as an Investment Principal at Shell Ventures, where I was responsible for the non-fossil fuels portfolio. Subsequently I was appointed the Commercial Head Europe for Shell Hydrogen and responsible for developing an industrial and mobility clean hydrogen business.

Currently I am the CEO of Battolyser Systems, a cleantech scale-up that develops and manufactures a breakthrough integrated battery/electrolyser product that can store electricity and produce green hydrogen from renewable power to balance societal demand with supply.

name: Aydın Şekercan
skills: ['Public Health', 'Healthcare improvement', 'Quantitative Research', 'Qualitative Research', 'Healthcare Management', 'Healthcare Analytics', 'Direct Patient Care', 'SPSS', 'Epidemiology', 'Data Analysis', 'Statistics']
summary:
Focus of research:

"Healthcare consumption by ethnic minority people in their country of origin: threatening or complementary?"

Currently, about 12% (2 million people) of the Dutch general population is of non-western ethnic origin. More than half of the Turkish and Moroccan migrants aged 55 or older make use of healthcare in their country of origin, partially because of lack of trust in the Dutch healthcare system. Dutch healthcare professionals and insurance companies are confronted with the consequences of healthcare consumption in the country of origin in terms of additional consultations, diagnostics, treatments, and costs upon return in the Netherlands. However, healthcare consumption in the country of origin cannot automatically be deemed as inappropriate. It can be a necessary continuation of healthcare in the Netherlands, or be associated with acute disease. Ideally, the quality of continued chronic care and medically appropriate acute care in the country of origin is similar or better to the Netherlands, whereas inappropriate healthcare consumption in the country of origin is avoided. 
In this, first of its kind, proposed study, I will analyse size, reasons, and appropriateness of healthcare consumption in the country of origin by ethnic minority groups. I will make use of unique complementary data sources: the HELIUS cohort and the Achmea Health Database. The results will provide health policy makers, insurance companies and healthcare professionals with essential knowledge to develop effective strategies to prevent overconsumption and to improve the cultural competence of healthcare provision in the Netherlands.

AMC themes:	Cardiovascular Diseases, Public Health & Epidemiology
Departments:	Cardiology, Social Medicine

http://www.amc.nl/web/Research/Who-is-Who-in-Research/Who-is-Who-in-Research.htm?p=4624

skills: ['Strategy', 'Corporate Social Responsibility', 'Strategic Communications', 'Marketing', 'Sustainability', 'Sustainability Reporting', 'Stakeholder Engagement', 'Artisan Enterprise Development', 'Business Innovation', 'Partnership Development', 'Social Entrepreneurship', 'Community Management', 'Digital Strategy']
summary:
Hi, I'm Jess 👋. I'm here to help impact leaders drive bigger, bolder, more sustainable change. Through my company Reconsidered, I create content, teach courses and consult on sustainable business strategy and communications for leading brands and organizations — all toward a vision of a more thriving, just and resilient world.

Since launching Reconsidered in 2017, I've had the privilege to support a range of future-focused clients including Etsy, EILEEN FISHER, Mailchimp, Sir Kensington's (Unilever), C&A, Tommy Hilfiger (PVH), BESTSELLER, JACK & JONES, J.Crew, Fashion for Good, Textile Exchange, Alliance for Water Stewardship and the UN Development Programme. My experience is centered in ESG strategy, communications, marketing, stakeholder engagement and impact measurement, with a particular focus on corporate social responsibility, environmental sustainability and social justice.

Prior to Reconsidered, I approached the impact space from a number of different perspectives — as a journalist, as an entrepreneur, as an academic and in-house at a Fortune 500 company. I spent several years leading ESG communications and stakeholder engagement at PVH Corp. and worked on sustainability initiatives with EILEEN FISHER, West Elm and the NYU Stern Center for Business & Human Rights. I also founded a social enterprise selling artisan goods made in Cambodia; led Content and Community at Quirky, an open innovation platform for invention ideas; and worked as a freelance travel writer across 60+ countries. I draw inspiration and motivation from my Chamoru (Native Pacific Islander) and Italian roots; my upbringing in Guam, San Francisco and Rome; and my toddler son's magical view of the world. 

Through Reconsidered, I get to:

💌 Curate a bi-weekly newsletter of fresh finds from the world of sustainable business that goes out to thousands of impact leaders every other week: http://reconsidered.co/sign-up

👩🏻‍🏫 Teach courses that aim to help impact leaders be the most effective agents of change they can be: https://www.reconsidered.co/courses

💼 Share jobs and career resources to support the next generation of impact leaders: https://www.reconsidered.co/jobs

👯‍♀️ Host a free private community of impact professionals that's been named one of LinkedIn's most engaged groups: https://www.linkedin.com/groups/13847179

I invite you to learn more about our work and DM me if you see an opportunity to partner!

I lead teams to develop new insights and scale their impact. My sharp eye for the abstract and the practical, helps me transform complex challenges into new solutions. With my enthusiasm and curiosity I get others on board and continue learning. 

After a career in academia, setting up innovative collaborations bridging research and practice, I fell in love with the dynamism and potential of the wider startup ecosystem. I fully enjoy helping the next generation of start-ups and scale-ups achieve their wildest dreams of making a positive societal impact with their venture.

However, to truly reach the scale of the transformation needed to address our most pressing societal challenges, we need more than impact scale-ups alone. We need governments, industry incumbents, knowledge institutes AND the next generation of startups to collaborate on developing and scaling new ways of working. 

🏗️ As senior program manager at TKI Bouw en Techniek I orchestrate collaboration between this full spectrum of partners in order to learn and innovate our way towards a CO2 free and future proof built environment. 

🌱On the side, as an independent consultant, facilitator and speaker at Havermans Consultancy and Scaling with Impact I enable collaborative learning about organizing and support impact scale-ups. 

My areas of expertise are leadership, analysis, collaborative change, learning into the unknown, scaling, and (positive societal) impact.

summary:
I work as an independent Business Community Builder and have spent over '10.000 hours' in "organizing value" by connecting people, ideas and organizations in Business Communities since 1988. I seek to “organize serendipity” i.e. my experience is that unexpected great value is often to be found by bringing different communities in contact with each other. This has resulted in numerous Program Management and consultancy positions focussed on bringing together Information Technology, Innovation and Impact.

One of my key communities is the 'Institute for Accountability in the Digital Age' (I4ADA) which I chair. The institute was set up in 2017 at the instigation of UNESCO to seek 21st-century solutions on how to manage accountability in the Digital Age. To help find these solutions I4ADA is connecting a global multi stakeholder community consisting of national and local governments, international policy makers and institutes, NGOs, civil society, the ICT industry and platforms, as well as other relevant organizations.

I have been invited to speak at or moderate numerous events around the world. I have presented in Africa, Australia, China, Europe, India, New Zealand, South-Korea, Sri Lanka, the United States. I advise and coach organizations and other communities on community building, collaboration and strategy - the shift from “Command-and-Control” to "Connect-and-Collaborate" thinking. Examples include IT-Circle Netherlands, IPBPM - Portugal, General Council - Netherlands, Dutch Government Innovation Community - Netherlands, Innovation Network Flemish Government. I work on a couple of pro-bono projects including the ITU AI for Good Global Summit, YPO's Impact Summit and Digital Africa. I have written various articles for BPtrends, Executive People and BPMagazine.

I have developed my expertise through various senior commercial positions with a number of organizations including Logica, Cambridge Technology Partners and Staffware/Tibco. Since 2009 I am self-employed​.

summary: Jan Knikker (Bad Soden Ts 1972) joined MVRDV in 2008. Before this he started his career as a journalist, and then shaped the public image of OMA for nearly a decade. He leads MVRDV’s branding efforts and has overseen the practice’s rapid expansion into new markets, focusing on solutions for global issues through its architecture and urbanism. He has worked on many publications and exhibitions, including the book MVRDV Buildings. Jan regularly lectures internationally, at commercial and academic venues in Germany (Polis Convention, Stiftung Baukultur), the UK (RIBA), Israel (CTBUH), Colombia (Universidad Nacional, Utadeo), Australia (RMIT), Kuala Lumpur (UCSI), and elsewhere.  He writes for various publications and is Deputy Editor of Domus 2019. He is a member of the Gestaltungsbeirat Wiesbaden, led the online design magazine Dafne, and from 2007 to 2011 was a member of the International Projects commission of the Netherlands Architecture Funds.

skills: ['Radiology', 'MRI', 'Healthcare', 'Medical Imaging', 'Computed Tomography', 'Medicine', 'Surgery', 'Medical Education', 'Diagnostic Ultrasound', 'Medical Research', 'Clinical Research', 'Hospitals', 'Digital Imaging', 'social media in healthcare', 'Carotid', 'Healthcare Management', 'Abdominal Imaging', 'Musculoskeletal Radiology', 'Cardiovascular Imaging', 'Ultrasound']
summary:
Kunt u onze podcast “Beter worden met Roos&Rozie” van Medisch Contact al?

Na 7 jaar als radioloog te hebben gewerkt en dit gecombineerd te hebben met andere ambities richt ik me nu op het samenbrengen van leiderschapsontwikkeling en  HR in de zorg en combineer ik dit in recente projecten met AI (Artificiële intelligentie) omdat ik ervan overtuigd ben dat iedereen nu toch echt minimaal een beetje notie zal moeten krijgen van AI. 

Misschien bent u arts en kent u mij als maker van de Medisch Contact podcast “Beter worden met Roos&Rozie”
Wij geven geaccrediteerde nascholing voor artsen die grip willen krijgen op de manier waarop zij werken. Dit doen wij in de vorm van masterclass persoonlijk leiderschap en de masterclass medisch management.

Voor meer informatie: over key notes door mij of masterclasses door Roos&Rozie: zie www.roosenrozie.nl of mail naar sietske@roosenrozie.nl

Op welke manier kunnen we en moeten we zorgprofessionals voorbereiden op de toekomstige en huidige ontwikkelingen en veranderingen in de zorg? En denk daarbij ook aan een werkomgeving waarin Artificial Intelligence toegepast zal worden. 
Wat is daarbij nodig? Dat is mijn favoriete vraagstuk. 
Omdat ik onder andere gefascineerd ben door het onderwerp “medisch leiderschap” in het kader van zorginnovatie is het voor jou als lezer van deze informatie belangrijk om te weten wat Leiderschap voor mij betekent: “Empowering everyone around you” en daarbij is een leider voor mij “anyone who takes responsibility for recognizing the potential in people and ideas, and has the courage to develop that potential.”

Mijn kracht ligt in het verbinden van medische vakinhoudelijke vaardigheden met de overige vaardigheden die wij als zorgprofessionals in de zeer nabije toekomst of nu al nodig hebben. 
Denk daarbij aan opleiden van zorgprofessionals mbt discipline overstijgend onderwijs, met als thema’s als innovatie, samenwerken in een netwerk, digitalisering, data science (AI), diversiteit, cultuur op de werkvloer, leiderschap, zichtbaarheid, etc. 
U kunt mij inzetten als verbinder, adviseur, spreker, trainer, moderator, dagvoorzitter en podcastmaker.
Ik heb de podcastserie “Leidinggeven in de zorg” gemaakt: 

https://podcasts.apple.com/nl/podcast/leidinggeven-in-de-zorg-tias-business-school/id1517372599

Mijn e-mailadres: sietske@roosenrozie.nl of  sietskerozie@hotmail.com

skills: ['Foreign Policy, diplomacy, Europe, EU, UN, Human Rights, Trade Promotion.', 'Diplomacy', 'International Relations', 'Foreign Policy', 'Politics', 'European Union', 'Policy Analysis', 'Human Rights', 'Government', 'Public Policy', 'International Development', 'Public Administration', 'Dutch', 'Policy', 'Public Diplomacy', 'International Organizations', 'Etiquette', 'Coaching', 'Interpersonal Communication Abilities']
summary:
Jean-Pierre Kempeneers has been acting deputy Head of the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Warsaw since October 2022. He has been on special assignments at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands since 22 August 2022. Before that he was Ambassador, National Coordinator International Positions at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands since August 2016.

From early 2014 until summer 2016 he worked at Royal Philips as Senior Director Government Relations & European Affairs and Head of the Philips' European Office in Brussels.

Jean-Pierre is a frequent lecturer and moderator at student-/university events. Since March 2013 he has been lecturer, moderator, and co-designer of the Brussels module of Avicenna, Academy for Leadership. He has also co-designed training modules with (Z)LTO Academy for agri- and horticultural professionals.

He has been coach and mentor to various (young) professionals for more than 15 year.

Jean-Pierre has been a diplomat in the Dutch MFA since 1995. He worked in the Europe Department covering 29 European countries with his team. He was Human Rights chief in the Ministry and Deputy Director of Human Rights, Humanitarian Aid, Good Governance, and Emancipation.

From 2006-August 2010 he was Head of the Political Section of the Permanent Representation of the Netherlands to the United Nations in New York. He was also the spokesman of the Mission.

Before this he was the Chief of Cabinet of / Private Secretary to the Minister for European Affairs of the Netherlands from 2002-2006.

From 1995-2002 he dealt with EU enlargement in both the Dutch and Austrian MFA's, served at the Dutch Embassy in Vienna covering Austria and Slovenia and he was Head of the Economic and Trade section of the Dutch Embassy in Tel Aviv.

Before joining the MFA Jean-Pierre worked in the European Parliament as speechwriter to the President of the Liberals, Mr. Gijs de Vries.
In 1994 he was intern in the European Commission dealing with the Middle East.

He was participant in the Government wide leadership course of the Dutch Government from Jan 2012-Dec 2013.

In January 2010 he participated in the UN Senior Mission Leadership Course in Port Dickson, Malaysia. Jean-Pierre was rated best participant and top three participant of the last 11 courses (approx. 300 participants) by the mentors.

He is a lawyer by education. 

Jean-Pierre is an avid sportsman (running, cycling, soccer, skiing, skating, golf, tennis) and coaches a football team under 14 years and is often referee.

name: Gautham Ram
skills: ['Matlab', 'Pspice', 'Solar Cells', 'Power Electronics', 'High Voltage', 'Electronics', 'Sustainable Energy', 'Electric Vehicles', 'Testing', 'Engineering', 'Simulations', 'Analog Circuit Design', 'Signal Processing', 'PSpice', 'C', 'C++', 'Microsoft Office', 'Simulink']
summary:
Electric vehicles - EV charging - Power electronics - PV systems - Energy Storage - Demand Side Management - Wireless power transfer

I’m a Tenured Assistant professor in the DC systems, Energy conversion and Storage group in the Department of Electrical Sustainable Energy at the Delft University of Technology, The Netherlands. I am currently involved in several European research projects on electric vehicles, smart charging of EVs, power electronics and demand side management. I am the coordinator and a lecturer for Massive Open Online Course (MOOC) on Electric cars on edX.org with ~200,000 learners from 175 countries. 

During my PhD, I developed a solar powered V2G electric vehicle charger that is compatible with CHAdeMO and CCS/COMBO DC charging standard designed smart charging algorithms. The project was in collaboration with PRE Power Developers, ABB and UT Austin and showcased in the TU Delft research exhibition ‘dig-it’ 2017 and was awarded the ‘Most significant innovation in electric vehicles’ at the IDTechEx Show 2018 in Berlin. You can follow my academic work via Google scholar. 

I’m am passionate about electric vehicles and collaborate on projects related to DC micro-grids, energy management systems for smart grids, PV systems, battery storage and contactless power transfer. I have an MSc from the Delft University of Technology and B.Tech from National Institute of Technology Trichy in Electrical Engineering. I have worked for GE Global Research, Munich during my masters on power electronic based voltage controllers for distribution networks. I have collaborated with several industrial and public institutions namely DNV GL, Alfen, SolarNRG, AIT, driivz, Alliander, E-laad, Stedin, PRE and ABB. 

I’m constantly looking for collaborators and interested in hearing from former colleagues, managers, or just interesting folks working on electric mobility, PV and power electronics. So feel free to contact through Linkedin or via G.R.Chandramouli@tudelft.nl.

name: Jeroen van Erp
skills: ['Concept Development', 'Design Thinking', 'Design Strategy', 'Experience Design', 'Strategic Design', 'Service Design', 'Concept Design', 'Product Design', 'Art Direction', 'Corporate Identity', 'Graphic Design', 'Awesomeness', 'Web Design', 'User Experience Design', 'Brand Development', 'Logo Design', 'Visual Communication']
summary:
Jeroen van Erp graduated from the Faculty of Industrial Design at Delft Technical University in 1988. After graduation he started as a freelance designer. In 1992, he was one of the founders of Fabrique in Delft, which positioned itself as a multidisciplinary design bureau. He established the interactive media department in 1994, focusing primarily on developing websites for the World Wide Web - brand new at that time. 
Under Jeroen's joint leadership, Fabrique has grown through the years into a multifaceted design agency. It currently employs a staff of more than 100 artists, engineers and storytellers working for a wide range of customers: from supermarket chain Albert Heijn to the Rijksmuseum.
Fabrique develops visions, helps its clients think about strategies, branding and innovation and realises designs. Preferably cutting straight through the design disciplines, so that the traditional borders between graphic design, industrial design, spatial design and interactive media are sometimes barely recognisable. In Fabrique's vision, this will be the only way to create apparently simple solutions for complex and relevant issues in future. 
In recent years, the agency has won more than 130 prizes and nominations in the Netherlands and abroad. Fabrique also opened offices in Amsterdam in February 2007 and in Rotterdam in 2012.
Jeroen is currently innovation strategist and founding partner. He is as a strategist and concept developer closely involved in various projects including ones for the Design Museum in London, Schiphol Airport, the City of Agra (India) and the Dutch Design Week. 
Between 2015 and 2021 he was a full professor of concept design at the Faculty of Industrial Design Engineering / Delft University of Technology. He is a member of the supervisory board of What Design Can Do, the chair of the supervisory board of Eurosonic Noorderslag and member of the supervisory board of the renowned Arco furniture company.

Mijn passie is het begeleiden van mensen met werk en levensvragen. Dat doe ik al meer dan vijfentwintig jaar met veel plezier. 

➽ COACH/TRAINER
Als transformationeel trainer | coach | loopbaanadviseur help ik mensen kristalhelder hun resultaten te definiëren. In alle openheid ontdekken waar ze nu staan, om het gat tussen waar ze nu zijn en waar ze heen willen te bepalen. Ik help mensen bewust te worden van wat ze weerhoudt om hun doelen of resultaten te bereiken. Daarna maken we een geweldig speelplan dat niet alleen werkt, maar ook nog plezierig is. Ik versterk mensen met motivatie en verantwoordelijkheid. Ik neem ze de maat, controleer en steun ze om ervoor te zorgen dat ze hun afspraak met zichzelf gestand doen.

➽ AUTEUR
Met veel passie en liefde schrijf ik over mijn vak en mijn (levens)ervaring. Dit heeft geresulteerd in diverse E-books: Liever Assertiever, Liever Gelukkig met Mindfulness, 100 vragen van verlangen, Kwaliteiten en Uitdagingen, Van wens naar werkelijkheid en Communicatiestijlen. 

➽ ACHTERGROND
Motiveren, stimuleren, inspireren, leiding geven. Onder andere: Hoofd Personeel Organisatie en Informatie bij de gemeente Amsterdam en HRM Manager bij Broersma International Transport.

➽ SPECIALISMEN 
Loopbaanadviseur | Coach | Trainer | Outplacement | Transformeren | Balans Tussen Werk, Zorgtaken en Persoonlijkheid | Loopbaanbegeleiding | Assertiviteit en Grenzen Stellen | Communicatie | Stresspreventie en Burn-out preventie.
