summary:
As the leader of Capgemini The Netherlands, I am right at the heart of innovation. On a daily basis, I am speaking with companies about their digital journey and business challenges they face. Our team helps many of them to overcome these and innovate, which makes me proud. 

IT has proven to be increasingly important for creating a better world. Technology is making our cities grow smarter and will be crucial in fighting climate change. Just think of the ways in which the combination of IoT and AI can make transport or our healthcare system more efficient. Our company has a big role in transforming the future for the better. 

Doing this, it’s a delight to lead our talented Dutch team, which goes above and beyond for our customers. An organization should be a reflection of the society in which it acts, and that’s why creating a diverse and inclusive workforce is crucial to me. In such an environment, people feel encouraged to bring their perspectives to the table and will get the best out of themselves, which creates a good basis to thrive as a company.

Outside of the company walls I am a frequent speaker at events and an experienced board member, sitting in various supervisory boards and act as an ambassador of the University of Twente, where I got my engineering degree.

name: Daan Dohmen
field of studies 1: (dr. / Ph.D) - Behavioural Sciences / Implementation of e-Health - cum laude
field of studies 2: (ir. / MSc.) - Industrial Engineering, Management of Medicine / ICT in Healthcare
skills: ['Entrepreneurship', 'Healthcare', 'eHealth', 'Start-ups', 'Marketing Strategy', 'Strategy', 'Program Management', 'New Business Development', 'New Media', 'Operations Management', 'Change Management', 'Marketing', 'Business Strategy', 'Healthcare Information Technology', 'Non-profits', 'Management Consulting', 'ICT', 'Analysis', 'Nonprofits', 'Coaching']
summary:
The future belongs to those who create it!

I started out as a carer for the elderly, and subsequently envisioned how the power of technology can transform care delivery as part of my PhD on Digital Health. Today, I am a Professor of Digital Transformation in Healthcare, an entrepreneur, a best-seller author and advisor to the Dutch government. With up to 25 million registrations in eight countries in Europe and Africa, our company Luscii is one of the fastest growing remote monitoring platforms on the market. 

Based on my experience and research, I am actively explore the three most important trends in the field of digital transformation in healthcare for the next two to three years. Digital transformation is an often quoted phrase, but how can it give patients more control and free up time for care providers? In my work I provide international examples and study results. I also reflect on how healthcare providers can organise themselves to succeed in transforming care, based on my lessons learned during an intensive private period in which he had to say goodbye to two young family members and a coincidental and unique connection with military colleagues in the Dutch Special Forces...

My values freedom, integrity and creativity guide me and strengthen my belief we should create our future ourselves!

Will you join me on my mission?

Willemijn is a founding member of Land Life Company and leads its operations globally. Land Life Company's mission is to help restore the world's two billion hectares of degraded land. In her capacity, she works with organisations across the globe to develop and implement large scale reforestation projects that mitigate climate change and revitalize ecosystems.

name: Calvin Rans
skills: ['Aircraft', 'Teaching', 'Research', 'Aerospace', 'Aerospace Engineering', 'Composite Structures', 'Matlab', 'Finite Element Analysis', 'Damage Tolerance', 'Materials', 'Composites', 'Technical Writing', 'Experimentation', 'Simulations', 'Abaqus', 'Numerical Analysis', 'Aviation']
summary:
Award-Winning Teacher and Playful Academic Researcher with 14+ years in the aerospace engineering domain of academia. I devote my time to making academia a safe space for failures – both in research and in education. Through my research, I create and study material and structural failures in the lab in order to improve the safety of future aerospace platforms. In my education, I challenge students to take risk and experience failure and teach them the important difference between experiencing failure and being a failure.

How do I achieve this? With a lot of trial and error, but also a lot of fun. Some recent examples of this include:

• Developing a failure-themed academic planner that leverages the symbol of a Flight Data Recorder and challenges students to assume the role of an accident investigator in their own academic journey

• Re-framing the emergency online education period necessitated by COVID-19 as a manned mission to Mars where factors such as remote learning/communication, effects of isolation, and dealing with technical issues could be openly examined

• Developing open educational resources, including the Hannah Hypothesis character who helps teach students the value of failure in the scientific method

I enjoy challenging the status quo and working in diverse teams to develop new approaches to generating and disseminating the necessary skills and knowledge in academia. Moreover, I simply love to share ideas and learn from others, so please feel free to reach out and contact me here on LinkedIn!

name: Mirjam de Blécourt
skills: ['Reorganisation', 'Legal Advice', 'Employment Law', 'Outsourcing', 'Mergers', 'Restructuring', 'Mergers & Acquisitions', 'Litigation', 'Securities Regulation', 'International Law', 'Dispute Resolution', 'Intellectual Property', 'Tax Law', 'Commercial Litigation', 'Joint Ventures', 'Cross-border Transactions', 'Corporate Law', 'Corporate Governance', 'Privacy Law', 'Competition Law']
summary:
Mirjam de Blécourt has been repeatedly recognized by top legal directories as one of the leading labour and employment lawyers in Europe and the Netherlands. She leads Baker McKenzie’s Amsterdam Employment and Pensions Law practice group. Furthermore, Mirjam was a former member of the Firm’s European Employment Group Steering Committee and board member of Baker McKenzie’s Amsterdam office.

Mirjam advises the boards of multinationals on labour law issues in the broadest sense of the word. She is the name giver and founder of a collective redundancy system called the ‘de Blécourt Method.’
Mirjam is actively involved in and has been committed to diversity and equal treatment of women for many years.

Partly for this reason she has held a board position on the Global Ethics Committee of Baker McKenzie and was involved in the establishment of the Women Leadership Programme. Furthermore, Mirjam contributed to the Dutch law setting the target figure for a balanced distribution of seats between men and women on boards of directors and supervisory boards of companies.

In addition to her position at Baker McKenzie, Mirjam sits on various boards and advisory committees. She serves as chair of the Board of the Rutgers (an influential foundation of expertise on (women’s) health and rights). She is board member of Stichting African Parks Foundation and member of the advisory committee to Stichting Female Cancer Foundation. Since 2019 she joined the Dutch Parliament as a member of the Senate for VVD (People’s Party for Freedom and Democracy) and is a member of the BeneluxParlement.

For more information please visit www.mirjamdeblecourt.nl

summary:
I love solving problems and I especially love it when you get to try new ideas and find creative solutions. In my role I get a unique opportunity to connect with diverse people, exchange ideas and drive real change on topics that impact society around the topics of sustainability, SDGs and climate action.

In my current role I combine my passion for sustainability and climate action and apply this to the publishing industry. In practice this means I get to work on driving real action on climate and the SDGs and even helping to launch the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Children’s Book Club and the SDG Publishers Compact.

Outside of work, I am an Aussie expat who loves eating great food and remains totally addicted to coffee. I am a proud mother, a strong advocate for gender equality and inclusion and attempt to live sustainably by #sayingnotoplastic.

name: Martijn Lopes Cardozo
skills: ['Product Management', 'New Media', 'Online Advertising', 'Strategy', 'Management Consulting', 'Digital Marketing', 'Strategic Partnerships', 'Telecommunications', 'Program Management', 'E-commerce', 'Business Intelligence', 'Leadership', 'Marketing Strategy', 'Business Strategy', 'Mobile Devices', 'Start-ups', 'Management', 'Corporate Development', 'Product Development', 'Change Management']
summary:
Growing up, on my way to school, I cycled 7 km through the lush forest surrounding my hometown, filling my lungs with fresh crisp air. I can still remember it vividly. Looking back, I find that these bike rides are among my happiest memories.

This privilege I had as a kid, enjoying nature, has evolved into the core of my mindset as an entrepreneur and an executive. My business ventures and corporate positions reflect both a sense of purpose in wanting to do good, as well as creating an environment for others to thrive.

I like to think critically, challenge the status quo, and rock the boat a bit whenever I see potential opportunities by doing so. I strive to empower and support talented people to do the same, and want to create an environment in which they can. In my view, all employees truly are stakeholders too, and I find that often the most valuable insights about a company are found when an executive has their boots firmly on the ground.

At the crossroads of these views on business I found myself coaching over 200 start-ups, most of them involved in clean energy, at the campus of my alma mater TU Delft. Later I founded Black Bear Carbon, which pioneered in bringing the circular economy to the tire industry. In my role as CEO I was invited to join the supervisory board of Circle Economy. My decision to make room for a new executive team at Black Bear coincided quite strikingly with the position of CEO at Circle Economy becoming vacant. When I was asked by the board to step in, I felt it was my duty to do so.

At Circle Economy I feel lucky to work closely with bright, talented and deeply motivated people towards a shared goal of making the world more circular. Creating an environment for them to thrive and develop themselves and also learn new things myself everyday, my current role feels like the culmination of every step previously mentioned.

Specialities: circular economy, regenerative economy, donut economy, nature-based, digital strategy, corporate development and M&A, analytics and big data; lead generation, sales, product management,(local) digital advertising, radio, television and mobile markets, investing, organisational transformation

BACKED BY an engaged and capable group of ACTIVE ENTREPRENEURS and SENIOR MANAGERS, 
who have active business networks 🌐 , which can be used for business leads, potential hirings and what not

- deal-by-deal investing ensures FLEXIBILITY 🤸‍♀️ in terms of 1. investing in new shares and existing shares 2. % stake 3. (exit) timelines 4. follow-ons, 5. geo, 6. sector, etc., as we don't have a strict fund mandate

[For text in English, please see below 👇🏻] 

Inhoudelijk gedreven onderzoeker en directeur/bestuurder met meer dan dertig jaar ervaring. Beleidsevaluatie, onderzoek, kennis, lerende organisaties, financiën, toezicht, samenwerken en het aansturen (en blijven leren) van professionals en de praktijk; dat zijn de termen die mijn werk en visie daarop samenvatten. Met de nodige projecten en publicaties, waaronder 'Beleidsevaluatie in theorie en praktijk' (2020). 

Vanuit de Erasmus Universiteit Rotterdam, het Ministerie van Financiën en de Algemene Rekenkamer heb ik uiteenlopende beleidsterreinen onderzocht, ook internationaal. Van mei 2013 tot september 2021 richtte ik me op verkeersveiligheid, als directeur-bestuurder bij SWOV: het nationale instituut voor wetenschappelijk verkeersveiligheidsonderzoek. 

Op dit moment ben ik directeur van IOB - de (inhoudelijk onafhankelijke) directie voor Internationaal Onderzoek & Beleidsevaluatie bij het ministerie van Buitenlandse Zaken. Daarnaast ben ik actief in de redacties van 'Evaluation - The International Journal of Theory and Practice' en 'Bestuurskunde' van de Vereniging Bestuurskunde. Meer informatie: https://www.algemenebestuursdienst.nl/actueel/nieuws/2021/06/18/peter-van-der-knaap-directeur-internationaal-onderzoek-en-beleidsevaluatie-bij-bz

I am a researcher/evaluator and managing director with over thirty years of experience. Policy evaluation, research, public finance, audit, organizational learning, and knowledge management, together with purpose driven cooperation and management characterize my work. 

Right now, I just started my position as director of IOB, the independent Evaluation Institute with the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Before that I worked on improving road safety with SWOV, as director for policy evaluation and performance audit with the Netherlands Court of Audit and as head of Evaluation with The Netherlands Ministery of Finance. I was chairman of the Dutch Evaluation Society 'Vide' from 2016 - 2022.

summary:
Prof. dr. J.C.J. (Hans) Boutellier (1953) is bijzonder hoogleraar Polarisatie en veerkracht bij de Faculteit Sociale Wetenschappen aan de Vrije Universiteit. Hij is expert op het terrein van veiligheid en samenleving en was gedurende zestien jaar directeur van het Verwey-Jonker Instituut. In 2019 werd hij benoemd tot Officier in de Orde van Oranje Nassau vanwege zijn bijdrage aan beleid en wetenschap. Hij zet zijn werkzaamheden voort onder de noemer Studie & Strategie: zie www.studie-en-strategie.nl. 

Boutellier schreef, zowel wetenschappelijk als populair, honderden publicaties vanuit een politiek-moreel perspectief over veiligheid, leefbaarheid en samenleving. Hij publiceerde vijf boeken. Voor 'De veiligheidsutopie' (2002) ontving hij de publicatieprijs van de Stichting Maatschappij Veiligheid en Politie. Zijn boeken werden ook in het Engels (en Frans) uitgegeven. Zijn laatste boek is 'Het nieuwe Westen. Over identiteitspolitiek en polarisatie' (2021).

name: Willi Gottstein
skills: ['Molecular Biology', 'Science', 'Bioinformatics', 'R', 'Life Sciences', 'Computational Biology', 'Systems Biology', 'Biochemistry', 'Mathematical Modeling', 'Python', 'LaTeX', 'Linux', 'Matlab', 'Git', 'Machine Learning', 'Data Analysis', 'D3.js', 'Constrained Optimization', 'Flux Analysis']
summary:
Computational systems biologist with a strong interest in combining lab automation and machine learning into autonomous experimentation platforms (aka "self-driving laboratories", see e.g. Häse et al. 2019). Using this closed-loop experimentation approach, system properties can be optimized in an iterative and fully automated manner and therefore represent the perfect implementation of a Design-Build-Test-Learn-cycle (DBTL). I wrote a short article about this topic here: https://willigottstein.medium.com/you-are-applying-design-build-test-learn-cycles-57db3604d579

I highly enjoy working in multidisciplinary, focused and dedicated teams that tackle challenging scientific and business relevant problems. In my current role, I lead a project on closed-loop-experimentation which includes building the required ML framework for iterative product development based on Bayesian Optimization, setting up the required cloud-based data architecture as well as the development of down-scaled assays required for data generation. 

Furthermore, I also still enjoy hands-on work which mainly involves data analytics using Machine Learning, -omics analysis, the reconstruction, simulation and visualization of genome-scale metabolic models as well as building/maintaining computational infrastructure required for Automated Strain Engineering (ASE) and High-throughput Screening. I mainly use Python and Java, build REST APIs and Front-ends so that also people with little or no programming experience can access analysis tools. 

In addition to the scientific work, I am also responsible for the piloting and roll-out of software tools across R&D sites with more than 100 users.

summary:
Ik zie mijn gratis hulp als verbinder van baanzoekenden, stagiairs & afstudeerders als ‘terugbetaling’ aan de maatschappij voor de mooie carrière en kansen welke ik heb gehad.

Mijn persoonlijk netwerk - vlgs mij het grootste van Nederland met inmiddels bijna 112.000 connecties & volgers (na aanpassing op 25 mei 2023 door LinkedIn) - groeit nog steeds.

- Baanzoekend (alle leeftijden) stagiair of afstudeerder wil je jezelf presenteren of wil je een oproep plaatsen? Laat het mij weten op LinkedIn of stuur een mail naar: robmes2012@gmail.com
Ik wil deze gratis voor je delen/liken/plaatsen in mijn netwerk.

- Werkgevers/recruiters/zzp-ers/ondernemers hebben jullie een vacature/vacatures, zoek je opdrachten/opdrachtgevers of heb je een (commerciële) vraag of oproep? 
Stuur dan een mail naar: 
robmes2012@gmail.com en vraag naar de voorwaarde waaronder ik deze in mijn netwerk plaats.

Nog niet met mij verbonden? 
Ga mij dan ‘Volgen’ op LinkedIn. Voor 'volgers' is er geen limiet. Je kunt mij mailen indien nodig. Zie  mijn mailadres bij baanzoekend⬆️
Ontvangen uitnodigingen om te connecten kan ik helaas NIET meer ACCEPTEREN, omdat ik al jaren geleden de limiet voor 1e graads connecties (30.000) heb bereikt. Ik moet deze dus helaas ‘negeren’.
Maar soms geeft een 1e graads connectie aan dat hij/zij een baan heeft gevonden en zijn/haar 'connectie' plaats wil omzetten naar een 'volgers' plaats. Af en toe heb ik dus wel eens een 'connectie' plaats vrij.

#demusketiers
Deze # is door mij gemaakt en is bedoeld voor hen die baanzoekenden, stagiairs en afstudeerders willen helpen met een groot bereik van hun oproep.
Door hun oproep - voorzien van deze # - te liken en/of van een commentaar te voorzien, wordt de kans op een baan, stage of afstudeeropdracht aanmerkelijk vergroot.
Volgen van deze # is vanzelfsprekend gratis. Inmiddels heeft deze # 4300+ volgers.
Word jij ook een volger?

Nieuw
#WalkieTalkie = wandeling en een praatje.
Tijdens mijn bijna dagelijkse wandeling door de natuur in Midden Delfland kunnen we - als je dat wilt - elkaar live ontmoeten en spreken, met als onderwerp de arbeidsmarkt in de ruimste zin van het woord en jouw positie daarin. 25 connecties/volgers hebben hiervan - in een paar maanden tijd - al gebruik gemaakt.
Hieraan zijn geen kosten verbonden.
Stuur mij een e-mail - zie ⬆️ voor het adres - en dan maken we een afspraak.

name: Renske ten Ham
position 1: Assistant Professor Health Technology Assessment at Julius centrum
skills: ['Pharmaceutical Industry', 'Health Economics', 'Pharmaceutics', 'Pharmacology', 'Pharmacy', 'Life Sciences', 'Lifesciences', 'Clinical Trials', 'Clinical Research', 'Healthcare', 'Statistics', 'Biotechnology', 'SPSS', 'Dutch']
summary:
Renske ten Ham is an assistant professor at the UMC Utrecht in the Netherlands and specializes in health economics & health technology assessment (HTA) of regenerative medicines, including gene and cell-based therapies. Trained as a pharmacist and with an MSc in HTA, she holds a PhD in Drug Innovation titled: “Development, market authorization and market access of gene- and cell-based therapies”.

At the Julius Center Renske is lead of the Regenerative Medicines (RM) team within the Health Economic Evaluation-group. She strives to increase translation of RM and (academic) gene and cell-based therapies towards implementation in healthcare services. In doing so her research focusses on payment models, development cost, (early) economic evaluations and business models. She aims to contribute to better understanding of the fit between innovative therapies and existing development frameworks. This is not only relevant for RM but also for future biomedical innovations.

name: Eline van den Broek-Altenburg, PhD
skills: ['Politics', 'Public Policy', 'Political Science', 'Policy', 'Public Affairs', 'European Union', 'Policy Analysis', 'Research', 'Policy Research', 'Journalism', 'Healthcare', 'Editing', 'Policy Writing', 'Fundraising', 'International Relations', 'Policy areas', 'Politicians', 'Political Systems', 'Journalists', 'Journals']
summary:
Dr. van den Broek-Altenburg is a trained health services researcher and (tenure track) faculty and Vice-Chair of Population Health in the Department of Radiology at the University of Vermont. She holds a PhD in Health Services Research (cognates in Biostatistics, Epidemiology and Economics) (2018), MSc in Public Health (2014) and MA in Political Science (2003). 

Her research focuses on analyzing and predicting human decision making in health. She uses advanced choice modelling methods to analyze patient and provider preferences in terms of their evaluation of alternative options and trade-offs. She recently received a grant to further explore non-compensatory decision making in healthcare and she is particularly interested in developing models that better capture individual preference heterogeneity and previously unobserved factors that have an effect on preferences. She has been developing patient-centered value assessment methods to inform value-based care incentives.

Dr. van den Broek-Altenburg also evaluates the clinical and economic effects of health care interventions. She leads economic evaluations in Vermont, using EHR, claims and text data. For the past decade and a half, Dr. van den Broek-Altenburg has collaborated with policy makers and clinicians to develop standardized quantitative measures to compare health systems and assess health system performance. She also leads efforts to improve the data infrastructure facilitating structural health system evaluation.

Since the global outbreak of COVID-19, Dr. van den Broek-Altenburg has contributed to a number of population health studies, including one identifying factors that may increase or decrease the risk of infection, and international studies analyzing COVID-19 vaccine preferences and the impact of the crisis on individuals, both in health, financial and psychological terms.

In 2005, Dr. van den Broek-Altenburg founded a think tank in The Hague and served as its director until 2012. She has also worked as a health policy fellow with several research institutes in Europe and the US and she was health policy adviser in the Dutch and European Parliaments. She contributed to the public debate by publishing scholarly papers and op-eds and was frequently seen in the media. In 2012, she went back to academia and has since won several awards and grants for her research. 

#leadership #populationhealth #healtheconomics #evaluationscience #healthpolicy #hospitals #electronichealthrecords #valuebasedpayments #ChiefScientificInformationOfficer #data #consultancy #topvrouwen.nl

name: Annetje Ottow
position 1: President of Leiden University’s Executive Board
skills: ['European Law', 'Competition Law', 'Economics', 'Economic Regulation', 'Dutch', 'Administrative Law', 'Legal Advice', 'EU Competition Law', 'Public Policy', 'European Union', 'Legal Research', 'Public Administration', 'Energy Law', 'Government', 'Mergers & Acquisitions', 'International Law', 'Strategy']
summary:
Professor Annetje Ottow was the Vice President of the Executive Board Utrecht University until October 2020. Previously she was the Dean of the Faculty of Law, Economics and Governance. 

Annetje Ottow is currently Professor of Public Economic Law at the Law Faculty of Leiden University. She concentrates on the fields of market regulation and regulators, competition and European law. 

Annetje Ottow was Vice President and member of the  Non-Executive Board member of OPTA, the Dutch Independent Post and Telecommunications Authority and  non-governmental adviser to the International Competition Network (ICN). She was visiting professor at the Florence School of Regulation of the European University Institute of Florence  and at the Competition Law Center of the George Washington University, USA.

Before entering the public service and academia, she was a lawyer in private practice for 16 years, active in the areas of competition and regulation. 

From 2013 until 2016 she was member of the Supervisory Board to VU University Amsterdam and the VU Medical Hospital.
From October 2013-2018, Ottow was Non-executive Director to the Board of the CMA (Competition and Markets Authority) in the UK. From  December 2013-2021, Ottow was member of the Supervisory Board of Het Juridisch Loket (Dutch Legal Helpdesk).

In March 2015, Annetje Ottow’s book “Market and Competition Authorities:
Good Agency Principles” was published by Oxford University Press, where she identifies five principles: legality (L), independence (I), transparency (T), effectiveness (E), and responsibility (R), 
which I refer to jointly as the LITER principles. These five principles prove to be fundamental to a framework for agency design and actions, both for the agencies themselves, and also for the actors reviewing the agencies’ actions. 
 
Photo credits: ANP

Daan is a lawyer (advocaat) and commercial litigation partner. He specializes in liability and contract law, procedural law and mass claims. Daan heads Van Doorne’s dispute resolution team, which is one of the largest dispute resolution teams in the Netherlands. He was a partner with De Brauw Blackstone Westbroek before he joined Van Doorne as Head Litigation. Daan has represented leading corporations and multinationals in both jurisdictional and multi-jurisdictional complex commercial litigation and class actions and has advised a broad spectrum of clients on all kind of liability and commercial contracting issues. He has been involved as lead counsel in numerous landmark litigation cases in the Netherlands. Daan also is trusted advisor of various leading corporations in the Netherlands.

Besides being a lawyer, Daan serves as a deputy judge (rechter-plaatsvervanger) in the District Court of Noord-Holland and regularly lectures and publishes on liability and contract law, procedural law and mass claims.

His work has won him the ILO’s Client Choice Award for best Litigation lawyer in the Netherlands. Furthermore, Daan and his team have been ranked tier 1 in the Legal 500 EMEA and Chambers for many years and Daan is recommended there as key lawyer.

name: Patrick Huntjens
position 1: Professor of Governance of Sustainability Transitions
position 2: Lead Author IPBES Transformative Change Assessment
field of studies 1: Complex system sciences and Policy sciences
degree 1: Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) Magna cum laude
skills: ['Societal Transformations', 'Water Management', 'Climate Change', 'Sustainable Development', 'Sustainability', 'Water', 'Climate Change Adaptation', 'Environmental Policy', 'Environmental Awareness', 'Policy Analysis', 'Water Resources', 'Capacity Building', 'Natural Resource Management', 'Environmental Impact Assessment', 'Environmental Management Systems', 'Environmental Science', 'International Development', 'Ecology', 'Policy', 'Public Policy']
summary:
Prof. Dr. Patrick Huntjens is award-winning author of ‘Towards a Natural Social Contract’ (2021), for which he received the prestigious Nautilus Book Award (Gold Medal) for best book of the year 2022 in the category 'World Cultures' Transformational Growth and Development'.

Patrick is Professor of Governance of Sustainability Transitions, Maastricht Sustainability Institute (MSI), School of Business and Economics (SBE), Maastricht University.

Patrick is also Professor of Social Innovation & Governance for Sustainability at Inholland University of Applied Sciences. In this role, he was awarded the national title ‘Professor of the Year 2021’. 

He currently serves as Chairman of the Round Table Food Transition (2021-2025) by DuurzaamDoor, a multistakeholder knowledge and innovation programme by the Netherlands Government.

For the Intergovernmental Science-Policy Platform on Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services (IPBES), United Nations, he serves as lead author of the Transformative Change Assessment (2022-2024).

Patrick has a multi-disciplinary background in Complex System Sciences and Policy Sciences (PhD Magna Cum Laude), in Political Science & International Relations (MSc Cum Laude), and in Biology/Ecology (MSc). For his PhD dissertation (2010) he collaborated with Prof. Dr. Elinor Ostrom, the first woman in history receiving the Nobel Prize in Economics. 

With 24 years of professional experience in the public, private and civil society sector, and on-the-ground work experience in more than 45 countries, Patrick’s work focuses on societal transformation, system innovations, and sustainability transitions at multiple levels (global to local). He is spearheading a Research and Innovation Agenda with a core focus on the Governance of Sustainability Transitions, with specific attention for issues of politics, power and justice in transitions, and drawing on the wider field of governance, commons, innovation and transition studies as well as other fields like complexity theory and systems theory. Ongoing research activities include 1) Transition to a sustainable and healthy agri-food system, 2) Governance of urban sustainability transitions, and 3) Transition to circular and regenerative economies and cultures.

He served as an advisor to the World Bank, United Nations, European Commission, various governments, and NGOs, among others. From 2014 to 2015 he was lead mediator (Track II) in the Israeli-Palestinian water conflict, assigned by the Geneva Initiative and the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

I am a university teacher (ecology, business, philosophy) at the Nyenrode Business School and at the Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University (taught outdoor master electives 'Sustainability Grand Challenges: Polluted Rivers' and ‘Companies in Ecologies’). I share my vision on ecology and economy with my nomadic school, Spring College. I collaborate with organisations such as Triodos, EPAMA, Waterschap Brabantse Delta, WaterNatuurlijk, C40, Unilever, the Province of Gelderland and the Rwandan Ministry of Health, as well as with innovative farmers, artists and indigenous communities.

As an author, speaker, and entrepreneur, Jurgen Appelo helps innovative organizations survive and thrive in the 21st century. He gladly shares stories, games, tools, and practices, so you can create your own way of working as a network organization. Most importantly, he offers the unFIX model for organization design, continuous innovation, and a better human experience.

Jurgen calls himself a creative networker. But sometimes he’s a writer, speaker, trainer, entrepreneur, designer, manager, blogger, reader, dreamer, runner, freethinker, or … Dutch guy. Inc.com has called him a Top 50 Leadership Expert and a Top 100 Leadership Speaker.

From 2008, Jurgen wrote a popular blog at NOOP.NL with ideas on agile management and organizational change. He is the author of the best-selling book Management 3.0, which describes the role of the manager in agile organizations; How to Change the World, which describes a supermodel for change management; Managing for Happiness, which offers you practical ideas to engage workers, improve work, and delight clients; and Startup, Scaleup, Screwup, which dives into the major topics that business leaders and entrepreneurs are confronted with throughout the business lifecycle. And the fifth book he is working will be Glitches of Gods ... a sci-fi novel!

Jurgen can help you upgrade your organizational structure with more engagement and faster results; He can show you how to increase your business agility with faster product development; He shows you how to creatively manage your company; And he can inspire creative professionals with a purpose, helping them integrate work and more joyful living.

Jurgen is CEO of The unFIX Company and Happy Melly and co-founder of the Agile Lean Europe network.

name: Frank Biermann
position 1: Research Professor of Global Sustainability Governance
position 2: Co-Editor, Cambridge Elements in Earth System Governance
degree 1: Habilitation in Political Science (postdoctoral qualification granting rights of a full professor)
skills: ['Sustainable Development', 'Environmental Policy', 'Sustainability', 'Political Science', 'International Relations', 'Climate Change', 'Social Sciences', 'Policy Analysis', 'European Union', 'Research', 'Governance', 'Environmental Impact Assessment', 'Lecturing', 'Climate', 'Politics', 'International Development', 'Economics', 'Public Policy', 'Climate Change Adaptation', 'Environmental Awareness']
summary:
Frank Biermann is a research professor of Global Sustainability Governance with the Copernicus Institute of Sustainable Development at Utrecht University, The Netherlands. He is an internationally leading scholar of global institutions and organizations in the sustainability domain. Biermann pioneered the ‘earth system governance’ paradigm in global change research in 2005 and was the founder and first chair (2008-2018) of the Earth System Governance Project, a leading global transdisciplinary research network of sustainability scholars. 

He currently directs a 2.5-million EUR research programme on the steering effects of the Sustainable Development Goals, supported by an European Research Council ‘Advanced Grant’ (the highest personal award from EU institutions) awarded to him in 2018, among other functions.

Biermann has authored or edited 18 books and published over 200 articles in peer-reviewed journals and chapters in academic books. He is frequently invited to participate in advisory and evaluation committees and has spoken in the United Nations General Assembly, the European Parliament and the European Economic and Social Committee.

From 2003 to 2015, Biermann was professor and head of the Department of Environmental Policy Analysis at the Institute for Environmental Studies, VU University Amsterdam, which was evaluated in 2014 as being ‘world leading’ and ‘one of the highest profile academic research groups involved with sustainability governance from around the world’. From 2007-2014, he was director of the Netherlands Research School for Socio-Economic and Natural Sciences of the Environment, evaluated in 2014 as a ‘network of excellence’. 

Biermann is an elected Fellow of the World Academy of Art and Science, a group of 700 individuals ‘chosen for eminence in art, the natural and social sciences, and the humanities’. In 2021, the Environmental Studies Section of the International Studies Association presented him with its Distinguished Scholar Award.

Researcher ID: http://www.researcherid.com/rid/D-4175-2013
Google Scholar: http://scholar.google.nl/citations?hl=nl&user=1PRxlBUAAAAJ

name: Gérardine Goh Escolar 吴美姗
degree 1: Brandon Fellow, Lauterpacht Centre for International Law
skills: ['International Law', 'International Relations', 'Policy Analysis', 'Diplomacy', 'International Organizations', 'Public International Law', 'Arbitration', 'Research', 'Strategic Policy Development', 'Operations Management', 'Strategic Planning', 'Space Law', 'Legal Writing', 'Legal Research', 'Commercial Litigation', 'Courts', 'German', 'Administrative Law', 'Policy', 'Public Policy']
summary:
I love being where emerging tech, sustainability, and international law and policy meet. I believe that innovation at the junction of these fields will allow us to build effective solutions to the challenges we face in our communities. I look for entrepreneurial and social impact opportunities that can be designed, implemented and iterated with an eye toward long-term sustainability and inclusive dialogue.

I am Deputy Secretary General of the Hague Conference on Private International Law (HCCH), an international intergovernmental organisation working towards the progressive unification of the rules of private international law. Concurrently, I head the International Commercial, Digital and Financial Law Division, which covers the Digital Economy project, the CBDCs project, and the Digital Assets and Tokens project. The Division also monitors the private international law implications of the securities market, web3, AI, DLT, automated contracting, tokenisation and fintech. 

I was on the founding team of various startups, including blumice (legaltech), and RapidEye (space-based geoinformation services – acquired by Planet). I served as legal officer with the federal government of Germany, advising on matters of space law and policy. I practised international arbitration and litigation with a top-tier law firm, and founded a boutique consultancy focused on international dispute settlement, technology (outer space, aerospace, cyberspace, FinTech and DLT), and investment consulting (with a specialisation in space-based tech at seed and early-stage). I have worked at the headquarters of three international intergovernmental organisations seeking to maintain international peace and security, improve access to justice and finance, and promote the rule of law. 

I am Full Professor (Adjunct) at the Faculty of Law, National University of Singapore, where I teach international space law. I am dual common- and civil-law trained, and read law at the National University of Singapore (LL.B. (Hons.)), University College London (LL.M.), and Leiden University (Dr. iur.). I have taught and conducted research at universities on three continents, including as Brandon Fellow at the Lauterpacht Centre for International Law, University of Cambridge. I am a member of the bar of New York State. 

Below are the series of lectures I have contributed to the United Nations Audiovisual Library:
Law of Outer Space: https://legal.un.org/avl/ls/GohEscolar_LOS.html (in English)
Private International Law: https://legal.un.org/avl/faculty/GohEscolar.html (in English, French and Spanish)

summary:
Leendert Bikker (1963) is an entrepreneur and developer by nature. Inspired by Frank Lloyd Wright ‘courage is the virtue of the spirit and decision the virtue of the will’. He has the ability to turn issues into opportunities and translates any crisis or conflict into chances.

He combines his entrepreneurial aspirations with his drive to make the world a better place. As founder and chairman of the award-winning monastery of business spirituality but also as the initiated chairman of the foundation capturing the largest wilderness of North West Europe, recently recognized by the Unesco as one of the world heritage areas. During the early years of this century he chaired Europe’s 500, the association of fast growing companies where he was listed twice. In the spring of 2014 he initiated the candidacy of Rotterdam as host of the World Expo in 2025.

Leendert dares to be different, knows how to blend the street with the C-suite and is an expert transforming social and environmental trends into business opportunities.

Leendert has four children. He loves sailing and is thrilled by the future by understanding the past.

Specialties: Vision, Authority, Reputation, Positioning, Branding, Radical Business Ideas, Issues, Media and Messaging, Change, Leadership, Future, Innovation, Corporate Communications, Economic Development

name: Rowinda Appelman
field of studies 1: Political Science - International Affairs I graduated Summa Cum Laude
skills: ['International Relations', 'Politics', 'Intercultural Communication', 'Research', 'Dutch', 'English', 'Event Management', 'Public Relations', 'Political Science', 'Teaching', 'European Union', 'NGOs', 'Leadership', 'International Organizations', 'Foreign Policy', 'Diplomacy', 'Integrity', 'Strategy', 'Empowering others', 'Initiating']
summary:
I am a driven community manager and social entrepreneur with a focus on education, innovation and diversity. In 2022, I was selected by the Obama Foundation as one of the 35 Obama Leaders for Europe in 2022. In 2018, I was selected by the Dutch Financial Times in their Top 50 most promising talents. In both 2015 and 2016, I was selected into the Top 100 Best Young Professionals in the Netherlands (spot 18 and 17, Memory Group Magazine). 

After having finished my Social Innovation Fellowship at the U.S. State Department as one of the first seven Europeans, I lead the Dutch cohort of 34 Global Shapers for the World Economic Forum. From May 2017 until September 2022, I worked with the city councils, universities and universities of applied sciences of the twenty biggest Dutch cities to innovate higher education on behalf of the Dutch government and all formal representative parties of higher education. As of October 2022, I started as a senior policy officer at the Dutch Ministry of Education, Culture and Science, with the task of connecting organizations and movements on a national level when it comes to education innovation in Dutch higher education. In April 2023 I was promoted to leading the taskforce on internationalization and international student streams. In 2012, I founded my own social platform AMS Connected, through which my team and I connected 4.000 Amsterdam locals and expats to each other and their local communities by hosting over 150 events per year. I handed over the lead for this platform in 2017, and still consult on the way forward for the team.

I have a background in Political Science (MSc summa cum laude at the University of Amsterdam) and Communication- and Information Sciences (MA summa cum laude at VU University Amsterdam), with a Minor in Military Science (at the Royal Military Academy).
